ProviderLocation: 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago , IL 60616-5093 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago, IL 60616-5093
ReviewText: The staff at Chicago South Loop were very helpful and always excited to offer assistance during our visit. We are from Kentucky so sometimes visiting a large city can be intimidating but we were always helped in a non-judgmental manner. The room was clean and spacious-we stayed in an executive King and very affordable. We were in the vicinity of our entertainment options and we always felt safe. I will definitely refer everyone I know to Chicago South Loop and will definitely keep South Loop in mind when we visit Chicago in the future..

ProviderLocation: 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago , IL 60616-5093 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago, IL 60616-5093
ReviewText: My husband and I travel a lot and visit Chicago 3 to 4 times a year. We have been seeking an affordable, nice hotel downtown with great service. The Chicago South Loop will be our go to hotel! We arrived late and had booked through Hotels.com. After checking in, being assisted by the security gentleman, we arrived to a large, clean room with a fridge, sitting area and huge bathroom! We immediately decided to stay 2 more nights and Diane went above and beyond helping us extend our stay! Nothing beats great service, and the Chicago South Loop staff goes above and beyond!

ProviderLocation: 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago , IL 60616-5093 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago, IL 60616-5093
ReviewText: This hotel would be a solid 3 1/2 star hotel PROS: very clean, very spacious room, reasonable price with a Groupon rate, free parking, fridge in room and small coffee maker. Dish network with a good variety of channels. Free internet and business center. Fresh and clean smelling lobby with a great staff. Bed and linens were comfortable, but average. CONS: about 1 1/2 miles from downtown. We had to take an uber numerous times over the weekend since we arrived by train. Few amenities in the room. And just the basic towels you would need. Room had older style of heating which we had to be adjusting to find a good temperature. We did not visit the small cafe, bar and lounge, fitness center or salon. Overall, it was clean and comfortable. Wonderful staff and reasonably priced but I would prefer to be closer to the city. This hotel was closer to the Mc Cormick center.

ProviderLocation: 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago , IL 60616-5093 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago, IL 60616-5093
ReviewText: We visited for a weekend away. Even though the hotel was under obvious renovations in the lobby and fitness areas it was still very nice. There was no charge for parking, which is few and far between. The staff was all very nice and helpful. They helped us decide transportation to the Bears game. There is a deposit that you get back upon leaving with no damage to the room. Would definitely stay again!

ProviderLocation: 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago , IL 60616-5093 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago, IL 60616-5093
ReviewText: Hotel was good, price and parking were great, but needed to take transportation into the city. Hotel is next to the bus stop, but must walk a few blocks to get to train station. If you are out past 9:00 pm, the staff would recommend an uber or taxi rather than walking around the area near the hotel at night. Train stop is in Chinatown.
ReviewTitle: Good hotel, but must take transportation into city.

ProviderLocation: 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago , IL 60616-5093 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago, IL 60616-5093
ReviewText: Unfortunately, my Amtrak Arrived Chicago Union Station five minutes after my next train had departed. Fortunately Amtrak had voucher's for Chicago South Loop Hotel. Awesome friendly staff. Clean hotel lobby and hallway's. Once in the room I noticed again cleanliness, tub, sinks, refrigerator, and floors. The Serta/Seally mattress-top cover/duvet absolutely made my night's sleep at Chicago's South Loop Hotel, the best hotel room sleep I can remember enjoying. Totally will stay here next time I'm in Chicago.
ReviewTitle: WOW Very Comfortable Mattress, Sheets, And Pillows. Very Deep Tub Too.

ProviderLocation: 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago , IL 60616-5093 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago, IL 60616-5093
ReviewText: The hotel staff was nice and helpful. The rooms are updated and spacious. Everything was clean. The lobby was peaceful and quiet. Parking lot was easily accessible and security was on the premises. Very modern and up to date.

ProviderLocation: 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago , IL 60616-5093 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago, IL 60616-5093
ReviewText: Amtrak put me up here overnight when the California Zephyr was nine hours late and I missed my connecting train. Nice, clean hotel with free wifi and comfy bed. Very nice front desk personnel gave me late checkout time. The only negative is the fitness room had two spinner bikes but no regular or recumbent exercise bikes.

ProviderLocation: 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago , IL 60616-5093 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago, IL 60616-5093
ReviewText: hotel was very poor facilities and what there were, didn't actually belong to the hotel. The room was large and had been renovated. however the hotel is very isolated in a poor area. there were a small coffee shop and a sports bar serving bar meals, neither [art of the hotel, the restaurant was only open one day in the week I was there and was poor. I would not recommend it for a tourist.

ProviderLocation: 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago , IL 60616-5093 11 West 26th Street , South State Street and W 26th St , Chicago, IL 60616-5093
ReviewText: I booked this hotel on Priceline a few months ahead of the October Chicago marathon and thought I was getting a 3 star stay. The hotel itself isn't bad but located in a dicey location- blight all around. Chinatown is 2 blocks away and overall food options aren't bad outside the hotel. The options inside are quite mediocre. The worst part, imo is that the Metra runs about 20 meters from the rooms facing the front of the hotel..approximately 45 percent of the rooms..so that killed my attempts to catch decent sleep before the race. The staff isn't great but can't complain there..it's consistent with the rest of the place. Overall, I'd caution against going here unless you have some idea of Chicago's layout. This borders the south side which makes it avoidable. On the plus side, it's close to McCormick Place convention center and all the major highways.

ProviderLocation: 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3586 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3586
ReviewText: What a great hotel! Fabulous location! We walked to dinner, Andys jazz club for some great jazz, and to Eataly for some wonderful Italian meats and cheeses and wine. Our room was beautiful with a great view. We were in the club level and the lounge was elegant and offered delicious breakfast and snacks. My favorite was the hotel bar with awesome views of the city and river! We enjoyed the best French 75 with cognac- I highly recommend it! Everyone there was helpful and willing to meet all of our needs. Sheer elegance! We had the best weekend getaway! We will definitely return!

ProviderLocation: 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3586 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3586
ReviewText: I had no idea where I was going, and I was surprised at such a nice hotel and fantastic staff. I had a small problem with the heating in the room, and I called, and 2 minutes later someone was in the room fixing it. At the lobby, they couldn't be nicer, and the restaurant great for breakfast and dinner!

ProviderLocation: 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3586 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3586
ReviewText: My wife and I decided on a winter weekend away in the big city and to see "Hamilton" in Chicago. Although it was expensive we decided to try the Langham, even though we had not heard much about it. The rooms were luxurious, immaculate, well appointed, with a top of the line bathroom and shower/tub finishings. Room service food was delicious. Service helpful, extremely polite, and punctual. The staff made us feel important. We truly hated to leave this wonderful hotel. We have been to high end hotels that left us disappointed. This one came through with flying colors.
ReviewTitle: Birthday Weekend Away in the Big City

ProviderLocation: 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3586 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3586
ReviewText: We decided to book an extended 'staycation' in downtown Chicago at our favorite hotel, The Langham. We have stayed here 4 other times and had expectations that were quite high. Well, what happened? The Langham once again exceeded them. They simply have much better service than any hotel in Chicago. By far. Timothy and Tommy in the Langham Club are so good, words cannot explain. Martynas also deserves special recognition--going above and beyond without being asked. We truly had one wonderful week at The Langham.
ReviewTitle: A Week at the Langham in February

ProviderLocation: 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3586 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3586
ReviewText: The Langham offers a modern take on luxury accommodations. The location makes it ideal for any type of travel. The service is over the top; all staff works to make your stay enjoyable. We have stayed here with children and they love it as well! The rooms are spacious, the bathrooms modern and top of the line. If you can afford any of the other luxury hotels in Chicago, and have not given this one a chance, you are missing out!

ProviderLocation: 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3586 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3586
ReviewText: What a great hotel - friendly staff, beautiful rooms, great spa, in the middle of everything. The club level is definitely worth it, with food and drinks throughout the day and superb service. Will stay here for sure on my next trip to Chicago.

ProviderLocation: 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3586 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3586
ReviewText: Had an amazing weekend stay there in February. Great experience. Room was perfect with an envious bathroom (tv in mirrow!!). Highly recommended among the many hotels I've experienced in Chicago and other major cities.
ReviewTitle: Great service. amazing room, wonderful times

ProviderLocation: 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3586 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3586
ReviewText: Great location within walking distance to all interest points. My first time at a Langham and what an impression. Room was one of the best I have stayed in, good facilities and a really comfortable bed. I stayed on the Club Floor, staff were wonderful and friendly, with great experience and in-sights on sight-seeing. Food was good and plentiful and the Club room was very spacious and comfortable and it was nice to enjoy the ambience. Being from the UK the time zone was difficult so the swimming pool and gym opening at 5:30 was useful to get a swim in before breakfast. Did 2 architecture trips with the the C.A.F very recommended, plus a an NFL game at Soldier Field. Chicago has so much to offer the international tourist . This hotel is at the centre of all the action and for architecture fans a must building to stay in.
ReviewTitle: Classy yet comfortable in great location.

ProviderLocation: 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3586 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3586
ReviewText: I have stayed at every 5- star hotel in Chicago and this one tops them all. Everything was perfect, the staff was courteous and helpful, the rooms were beautiful, the spa is a reason to return in itself. The only aspect of the hotel that could use improvement would be the main restaurant, but I only had one dinner there and it was just okay. The Club Lounge experience was nice but probably not worth the extra money. My room was beautiful and the bathroom was lovely with a wonderful, big tub. It was the perfect place for me to stay after a very stressful time.

ProviderLocation: 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3586 330 North Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3586
ReviewText: For a solo trip to Chicago, I decided to try an Executive room on the Club Level (18th floor) of the Langham Chicago. CL 118 is a lovely large room with nice Northern light (I was told that none of the Executive rooms face south) and two exposures, although the Eastern exposure faces the Trump hotel. Check-in was quick, but note that you check in on the 18th floor, so will need to go to the main check-in area to see the lobby with its beautiful chandeliers. Food in the Club Level was fine during the evening hours and for breakfast. However, I was hoping for sushi as described in the review posted on The Points Guy's website a year or so ago. Sushi wasn't happening. Would I stay on the Club Level again for an extra $100 for myself ($200 if traveling with my husband)? Probably not, unless I knew they were offering sushi.

ProviderLocation: 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: We came here to celebrate Valentines Day. We took an upgrade to a corner suite. A beautiful room with wonderful city views on the 15th floor. The room is well appointed with easy to work tech controls. The bed is wonderfully comfortable. The in room coffee maker is a hit with me. We used the bath tub for relaxing and viewing the city at the same time. Nice! Missed out turn down service though!?!?

ProviderLocation: 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: a hidden gem on the 4th floor of the peninsula hotel--the only restaurant owned by chinese in a major u.s. hotel. upscale exquisite service, superior food, lovely atmosphere overlooking skating pond on the terrace. also, private room.

ProviderLocation: 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: Out travel agent suggested the Peninsula for our stay in Chicago. We were to stay two nights but the snow storm in NY force us to stay another night. How marvelous to have to stay an extra night at this truly wonderful hotel. No detail has been left to chance for your physical and visual comfort at this hotel. Everything in your room is controlled by a tablet (like your I-pad) from asking for a turndown, dealing with how you like the lighting , to picking your favorite TV station. Look forward to a very quick return.
ReviewTitle: Why Can't I live there full-time?

ProviderLocation: 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: On our last visit to Chicago we stayed at The Langham, but enjoyed visiting the Shanghai Terrace restaurant so much we came for dinner at The Peninsula for both nights of our trip. This time in Chicago, celebrating our wedding anniversary, we stayed at The Peninsula - a part of our reason included the fact we would be on-site for the fabulous Shanghai Terrace restaurant. While I can say that our suite was lovely, we were incredibly disappointed to find out that we could not reserve a table for a day of our trip. We stayed in a gorgeous room, but could not visit the hotel's restaurant once (at any time), which was to be one of the true highlights of the visit. Detail orientated hotel, and lovely room, but couldn't get past the disappointment of being unable to reserve the table after booking the hotel, and couldn't pull off the perfect weekend anniversary experience as planned.
ReviewTitle: Great room, but no restaurant table for our anniversary

ProviderLocation: 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: I don't often give five star reviews but the Peninsula Hotel in Chicago deserves even more stars. We live in metropolitan Chicago and love to come to the city several times a year for weekend get-aways. We have a lot of favorite hotels and tend to stay at them over and over again. On this weekend we were meeting up with family and wanted to stay in a location that was really easy for them to get to. That and a gift certificate to the Peninsula’s Shanghai Terrace encouraged us to make a reservation at the Peninsula. Oh my goodness!!! Best stay ever anywhere and that is a bar we’ve raised pretty high over the years. Our room was gorgeous. The bed was superbly comfy. There was a lot of closet space and drawers so we could easily un-pack. The safe was so huge I could actually store my laptop in it. Pretty much everything in the room is controlled via tablet which was pretty intuitive. I’m kind of old-fashioned and really like light switches but had no trouble using the tablet to adjust lighting, room temperature, the TV and more. The bathroom was well appointed with a roomy tub and lovely toiletries - the tub actually came with a view of Michigan Avenue which meant Michigan Avenue or at least the tenants directly across the street also would have a view of me. Thankfully, there are really good shades! On our last morning, we decided to order room service and the reasonable uncharge was more than worth this extra pampering! Our food arrived promptly and was just as fresh as if we’d been sitting in the restaurant when served. We have a new favorite in Chicago and we’ll definitely be back.

ProviderLocation: 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: First time staying at a Peninsula hotel (I'm cheating on the Mandarin Oriental). The experience was phenomenal - this is a luxury hotel at it's best. The location is perfect for exploring Chicago - next to a load of restaurants and the best shopping district. Check-in was friendly and personal and they gave me an early check-in and late check-out until 5.30pm - something I really appreciate in luxury hotels. I think the hotel has recently undergone a refurbishment as far and away the best part of the hotel is the rooms. They literally have the perfect bedrooms in terms of layout, decor, bed, TV and amazing technology - everything is remote control and they even have a printer in every room. I especially loved the dressing area. Here are some of the amenities I took advantage of: - Highly recommend the pool! Beautiful. - I had a massage at the spa, was lovely but not unmissable, so you can skip unless you're addicted to massages like me. - Afternoon tea was good, the service was lovely, the food and value for money were ok for USA standards, but nothing comes close to a true English afternoon tea in London. The one disappointment was the concierge. An elderly gentleman helped me but he was incredibly miserable, rude and condescending when I was suggesting ideas. A smile goes a long way. But the rooms alone make me give this hotel 5 stars - I am now a Peninsula fan!

ProviderLocation: 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: Stayed at many 5 star hotels before in Chicago and around the world. Probably this hotel is in my top 3 world wide. Brand new renovated and modern rooms. Great hotel location in center of Michigan avenue. Perfect pool and spa. Excellent service. Beautiful lobby and tea time area. Good value for money ( although visited off season in January cold weather) Definitely will visit again next time in Chicago.

ProviderLocation: 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: The room was beautiful and the staff was incredibly attentive, paying attention to the smallest detail (e.g., the room staff left extra coffee pods for me when they noticed that I drank all of one kind). The only somewhat annoying thing is that every time I went down to the restaurant to eat, I was told they were "fully committed" with reservations and that I should go to Pierrot Gourmet (which requires going outside and is not even in the same ballpark as the lobby restaurant). The concierge fixed it by talking to the restaurant manager, but I would have preferred to not have to go through the extra hassle just to eat a quick lunch - they really should keep some tables open for hotel guests (that can be used without complaining to the concierge).

ProviderLocation: 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: We used to enjoy the Four Seasons Bar, but after the remodel it never felt the same. I stopped in for a drink at the Peninsula and was blown away by the quality of the food and the level of service at the Bar. I was immediately greeted and offered reading material. I enjoyed some of the outstanding Dim Sum from their Shanghai Terrace restaurant. The decor is classic and the bar comfortable. Five stars all around!

ProviderLocation: 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611 108 East Superior Street , at North Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: One on the best hotel in Chicago I've stayed upon check the out side was beautiful the inside was amazingly put the my stay at the hotel if felt like and king it was my birthday weekend I stay for 4 days the staff was amazing they treated me very well and my guest as well the room was so dope the bed was so comfy and big the bathroom was like something out of a home decor magazine you could live in there the location was in the heart of downtown it was the perfect stay they food was amazing and the brought me a special bday cakes which was surprisingly good since I don't like chocolate but it was good I will surely stay at this hotel once more if you ever get a chance to stay here you will not wanna leave your room I can say so many good things about this wonderful hotel but u have to see it to believe
ReviewTitle: By Far One Of The Best Hotel In Chicago

ProviderLocation: 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago , IL 60611 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: We loved the room, people and service at The Talbot. The location is close to Michigan Avenue and was walking distance to most things we wanted to see. We will definitely stay there again next trip to Chicago

ProviderLocation: 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago , IL 60611 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: We stayed at the Talbott during the World Series playoffs in October. Not only is the location perfect, but the staff can't be beat. The doormen are the most warm and elegant in the city, a wonderful sendoff and welcome always. Moved to finally write this review because of Concierge Gene Murray, whom I called when I realized I forgot a whole outfit hanging on the hook on the back of the bathroom door (the playoffs made for some boozy evenings at nearby Gibson's, Zebra Lounge, etc etc). Mr Murray and the housekeeping staff located my clothes and Fedexed them to my home in California. Thank you Mr Murray and everyone at the Talbott. See you soon!
ReviewTitle: Best location, amazing staff and vibe

ProviderLocation: 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago , IL 60611 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: I agree with most of the other reviews - nice little lobby, great fireplace, and comfortable. I would give 5 stars to the customer service component, all of whom are visible throughout your stay. I suppose from one viewpoint, one could easily say there is a "European Elegance" to the hotel. To the couple that reads good reviews, and expects an upgraded, clean room to go along with the reviews, this would not be your place. The rooms are very old and far more European than I am use to. Light pink and brown walls/carpet, with outdate amenities. For your dollar, if European elegance is not your thing, look down the street, hotels everywhere. With that being said, the place is well kept, and I don't mean to take anything away from the hotel, because I am sure it is what you pay for - a hotel with European elegance. Just not my thing. Thanks and good luck.

ProviderLocation: 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago , IL 60611 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: We really liked this hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The fireplace in the lobby is welcoming. Although we did not have any sort of view, our room was cozy and comfortable. A lot of people mention the slow elevator - hopefully this is something that might be addressed during the renovation that is going on right now. The best part about this hotel is the location! It is in a beautiful, clean, safe neighborhood and the block is very attractive. We enjoyed walking to dinner each night and returning to such a welcoming hotel. There was a bar and restaurant at the hotel but we did not try. I would recommend that the hotel give guests an incentive (ie free glass of wine) to prompt us to give it a try. We enjoyed four nights here and would gladly return.

ProviderLocation: 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago , IL 60611 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: Stayed for two nights and had a wonderful experience. It started off on the right foot when the doorman greeted us as we pulled up to the curb. He was an older gentleman who was warm, gracious, welcoming and sincere. The checkin was quick and efficient. We took a suite which was very large, clean and had everything we needed. The location was great was great for all of our touring. Just a great experience all around.

ProviderLocation: 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago , IL 60611 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: There are already a million reviews.. Got an upgrade; great location; spotless; faultless staff. Love it, would book again. I travel a lot; I'm Australian so treat effusive reviews with suspicion; still love it

ProviderLocation: 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago , IL 60611 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: Stayed 3 nights at the Talbott and got a room on the 15th floor which was actually very nice, spacious and clean. The decor looked a bit dated but was fine. Had street view but there isn't much to see. Location is very convinient a few minutes walk to the magnificient mile (good for shopping) and/or Hancock Tower. Also a subway station is only 2 blocks away. Around the corner are a few cafes for breakfast and some restaurants good for dinner. Staff I met was nice and knowledgeable. I was very happy with my choice and actually would stay again at the Talbott. The only complain I have is that I can't understand why it is rated so high. I think there are a lot of better hotels in Chicago especially in the area of the river. But maybe it's only because what you get for the price you pay it is excellent.

ProviderLocation: 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago , IL 60611 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: Perfect three-night stay at The Talbott. Charming boutique hotel, perfect location near both shopping and excellent restaurant options. Wonderful, warm service throughout, beginning with my call for reservations - done directly with the hotel and not some call center. Special thanks to Alicia for her courtesies and warmth on the phone, and to the entire front desk staff, who were consistently gracious, helpful, and professional. Great! Housekeeping staff was terrific. The bellman were uniformly gracious and helpful, as was the hotel concierge. The hotel restaurant was very nice, with a very gracious manager and serving staff. Sleeping room was large and immaculate, as was the bathroom. I was made to feel by the entire staff that this was truly my home away from home. Kudos to the hotel General Manager for creating the special culture that makes this hotel special.

ProviderLocation: 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago , IL 60611 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: This is my first ever Trip Advisor review and I'll begin by saying I am a self confessed hotel snob. The Talbott Hotel was PERFECT and perhaps the nicest place I have stayed for years (and I have stayed in thousands of hotels globally). I was a little nervous before arriving simply because the rate was so reasonable but as soon as I walked in I knew I had hit the jackpot. As always what makes a great hotel is it's staff and I'm yet to meet a nicer, more efficient group of happy friendly employees. The rooms are magnificent - spacious, luxurious and quiet. The beds sent me into the most wonderful jet lagged slumber and the shower hit me with the right amount of powerful jets required after a long sticky flight. I truly love this place so much so it made me create a Trip Advisor account, book soon because mark my words the secret will get out and the rates will go up!

ProviderLocation: 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago , IL 60611 20 East Delaware Place , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: Overall excellent, the staff are very friendly, welcoming you every minute they see you, you feel like you're in your home with your family. The hotel housekeeping are just great. - Thank you Tina The only drawbacks I saw: - they hold 75 USD per night on top of the nightly rate from my credit card, even they didn't take my permission to do, wich may put some people in troubles with thier budget and credit limit. - the lights in the room is very dark, annoyed me. - a little of noise both inside and outside of hotel. With all that, I will stay again if I visited Chicago later.

ProviderLocation: 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago , IL 60611-1174 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago, IL 60611-1174
ReviewText: This hotel provides phenomenal service which complements the perfect layout and decor of the Hotel. In my opinion this hotel is also located in the perfect spot of Chicago. The service here is also at the highest level.

ProviderLocation: 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago , IL 60611-1174 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago, IL 60611-1174
ReviewText: Good stay at the Thompson. First time here, one of my favorites downtown. Good price for the room you get good views. All of the staffpeople were courteous and the complimentary town car came in handy a few times we were headed out.

ProviderLocation: 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago , IL 60611-1174 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago, IL 60611-1174
ReviewText: Nice area for dining drinking. Safe private and inviting. Staff was friendly and engaging. I would recommend town car service verses cabs, I would even pay for the added service. Fabulous hotel in the heart of the best restaurants

ProviderLocation: 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago , IL 60611-1174 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago, IL 60611-1174
ReviewText: My wife and I revisited the Thompson Hotel this weekend. It's a nice hotel in one of our favorite neighborhoods. Staff is helpful and friendly. Rooms are nice. Nothing over the top, but no disappointments either.

ProviderLocation: 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago , IL 60611-1174 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago, IL 60611-1174
ReviewText: I visited The Thompson with my husband and what a great first impression. Beautiful building great location close to everything. Big beautiful doors gorgeous lobby with modern decor and an intoxicating fragrance. The front desk staff was very friendly and welcoming. Our room was beautiful it had a modern fresh look. Great view of the city from the 19th floor. Clean crisp linens super comfy bed and pillows,modern bathroom and great scented toiletries. They really put a lot of effort in the hotel mini bar,bath robe, slippers. There are too many things to mention, but definitely will be returning.

ProviderLocation: 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago , IL 60611-1174 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago, IL 60611-1174
ReviewText: This is charming hotel with personable individualized service and beautiful rooms.The location is also perfect i strongly recommend staying in this wonderful hotel, an alternative to the major international brands

ProviderLocation: 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago , IL 60611-1174 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago, IL 60611-1174
ReviewText: I can't say enough about this wonderful place. I can go on and on, but you have to experience it yourself. From the curbside greeting, to the front desk staff, housekeeping, the restaurant and bar and so on, everyone makes you feel welcome and truly valued as a guest. I've not had a better experience anywhere else. This is definitely a yearly destination for me!!
ReviewTitle: I'll be here on the yearly!!!

ProviderLocation: 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago , IL 60611-1174 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago, IL 60611-1174
ReviewText: This is the sort of city hotel that does a brilliant job if what you want to do is take advantage of the location to visit the nearby sights and of the comfortable rooms to get a good night's rest. All staff helpul...but doorkeepers exceptionally so. Food and drinks are a bit of an afterthought.....but there's plenty of great eating and drinking nearby
ReviewTitle: Nice room, nice location, nice staff

ProviderLocation: 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago , IL 60611-1174 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago, IL 60611-1174
ReviewText: The Thompson Hotel is a perfect spot for a Chicago vacation. It's location is perfect. It is clean, upscale, and the staff is friendly and accommodating. You can't go wrong with staying here. I would stay here again.

ProviderLocation: 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago , IL 60611-1174 21 E. Bellevue Place , Chicago, IL 60611-1174
ReviewText: This is a phenomenal hotel in one of the best locations in Chicago. The staff and service was above and beyond. I was really impressed with the doorman and the front desk staff. Really professional and understand customer relations. Rooms have great city views. The hotel is located in the Gold Coast, steps from the lakefront, steps from some of the best restaurants in Chicago (downstairs is Nico Osteria) Gibson's, LuxBar, Le Colonial, Hugo's to mention a few, and right in the heart of Oak Street and Michigan Avenue shopping. A great value for the location. It is not cheap, but will not break your budget. Loved it!!!!

ProviderLocation: 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago , IL 60611 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: My wife and stayed at the Park Hyatt for the first time and safe to say, we'll be back! Service was spot-on, rooms were spacious and modern and the location is perfect for wandering Michigan Avenue. We had drinks at NoMi, bartender was great. Didn't eat at NoMi but will try next time. Highly recommend.

ProviderLocation: 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago , IL 60611 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: First time stay at Park Hyatt and will definitely return. Friendly and professional receptionist started our stay in the right way. Enjoyed a delicious lunch at NoMI Kitchen on the 7th floor overlooking Michigan Ave. A great and relaxing stay at a well positioned downtown hotel.
ReviewTitle: Great Weekend in the Windy City

ReviewText: We stayed at the Park Hyatt for our trip to see the Lyric Opera. The hotel and its staff are exceptional and will attend to your every need! We cannot wait to return for a future vacation. Plan your next trip and stay at this high caliber property!
ReviewTitle: Stay at this relaxing oasis in Chicago!!

ProviderLocation: 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago , IL 60611 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: This is my second stay here in the last couple of months. This is a luxury hotel, so we had expectations of a lovely room, bathroom and common areas. Those expectations were more than met. We were given our complimentary AMEX upgrade to a room with a nice view of the Water Tower and Michigan Ave. What sets this hotel apart, however, is the staff. They go out of their way to be warm and friendly. The breakfast waiter (Louis) remembered our name the second morning, the front desk staff was quick with a, "Welcome Back," and even a small issue we had with housekeeping was met with an immediate visit from the housekeeping supervisor who offered a profound apology and a of bottle of wine. I think the resident dog, Parker, adds to staff moral and friendliness! ;) Overall, the GM is to be commended for the obvious "above and beyond" customer service training of the staff. They have made it our new favorite hotel in Chicago. Thank you!

ProviderLocation: 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago , IL 60611 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: I stayed for one night and booked through #AmericanExpressplatinum and man was it ever worth it. I was up graded to the executive suite. The room was HUGE with the best view I've ever had !! The spa was absolutely amazing as well !! What an experience!! Room service on point and a complimentary shoe shine !! What ?!?! I love this place !! I'll be staying here again !!
ReviewTitle: Amazing experience, stellar rooms and staff

ProviderLocation: 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago , IL 60611 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: If you're looking for an excellent luxury hotel in downtown Chicago and your primary criteria is location, there's no better choice than the Park Hyatt. ReviewTitle: A great luxury choice for downtown Chicago

ProviderLocation: 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago , IL 60611 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: This is a beautiful place with great service and friendly staff. I loved the big tub. The pool and hot tub and sauna were also wonderful. From the time i arrived everyone was very hospitable and i loved that housekeeping called shortly after i arrived to see if i needed anything.

ProviderLocation: 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago , IL 60611 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: Don't get me wrong. This is a very nice hotel and you can feel the luxury as soon as you enter the lobby. The staff were very professional and courteous, just not super personable. The room was spacious, and the bed was pretty comfortable. There are hundreds of tv channel, which could be overwhelming. But pretty nice LCD tv. The decor was somewhat modern, but I have stayed at nicer Park Hyatt, and I had a higher expectation. This one (at least the room) is more like a Hyatt Regency. And can we have a stronger wifi signal near the entrance? I had to walk around the lobby to get online to call an Uber.

ProviderLocation: 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago , IL 60611 800 N Michigan Ave , on Water Tower Square , Chicago, IL 60611
ReviewText: I thought this might be located a little more north than I wanted to be but I was so wrong. Best location EVER. I walked everywhere. Restaurants, museums, shopping, tours...all outside the door. their rooms are wonderful. I used the big tub every single day. The hottest water you can imagine and extremely deep. even ate dinner one night in the room. plenty of desk room. 2 tvs. view was great. just exceptional. I took the train up. rated 7th best luxury hotel in downtown Chicago.

ProviderLocation: 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago , IL 60611-1443 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago, IL 60611-1443
ReviewText: From the moment your car door is opened by the Valet you know you are somewhere special. This hotel is gorgeous - I know it's what we expect from the Four Seasons, but I was blown away by its beauty! Check in was easy and our suite was just fantastic. The view of Chicago city was something I will never forget. The bed was so comfortable and the lines were high quality. Every member of staff was helpful and friendly. The location is perfect for shopping and restaurants. I can't fault a thing!
ReviewTitle: LOVED EVERYTHING about Four Seasons Hotel Chicago

ProviderLocation: 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago , IL 60611-1443 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago, IL 60611-1443
ReviewText: When you book a room at The Four Seasons, you expect that it will be gorgeous, and this hotel will not disappoint. The rooms are so well done and the window seats make a lovely addition. The beds are luxurious and extremely comfortable. The bathrooms are beautifully appointed with great tub/shower combos that are much roomier than any I've been in before. Most combos are quite tight and these are not tight at all. We stayed in a king room, and I'm sure the suites are even more fabulous and probably have a different bathroom layout, but even the standard rooms have great bathrooms. There is parking attached to the hotel and shopping area at 900 N Michigan, and it is a nice benefit to have the option of getting in and out of your car while in Chicago, without having to brave the Chicago elements. The hotel employees were all extremely helpful and polite, and I honestly do not believe I saw one employee not smiling and being genuinely kind to the guests. If I had one comment, as a coffee lover, I did miss having coffee in the room, but having complimentary coffee in the lobby was a good second option. I would still prefer to have the option to make it in my room, and I understand that there is that option in the suites and higher level rooms. Again, this is not a big deal. It would not sway my decision to stay here in the future. I would hands down stay at The Four Seasons any time I find myself in Chicago, and you should too!
ReviewTitle: Gorgeous hotel in a fabulous location!

ProviderLocation: 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago , IL 60611-1443 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago, IL 60611-1443
ReviewText: We were in Chicago February 17-20. It was unusually warm weather and we had a wonderful time at the Four Seasons. We had not stayed there in 7 years because of a theft of an expensive coat from our car from the valet at the hotel. We finally decided to forgive and forget and to try the hotel again. We had a great experience and were happily upgraded to a large suite. It was not remodeled (which was disappointing) but the extra space was appreciated. We had drinks in the bar and breakfast in the restaurant two mornings. Room service one morning. All was more than adequate. We were able to use the house car once and that was appreciated. We visit Chicago often and have stayed at Trump, Langham, Ritz Carlton, Waldorf Astoria, Peninsula etc..I would return to Four Seasons.

ProviderLocation: 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago , IL 60611-1443 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago, IL 60611-1443
ReviewText: We stay at the Four Seasons Chicago several times a year and consider some of the staff to be our friends after seeing them there for so many years. Of course the service is impeccable and the facility is terrific, but what makes it a special luxury hotel is the warmth and genuine caring of the staff. No snootiness or aloofness here!
ReviewTitle: Home away from home for us

ProviderLocation: 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago , IL 60611-1443 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago, IL 60611-1443
ReviewText: Our stay at the Four Seasons Chicago was excellent, exceeding our expectations. It is a beautiful facility and the staff is superb; friendly and helpful starting with the doorman, to the Front Desk, to House Keeping and the restaurant wait staff.

ProviderLocation: 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago , IL 60611-1443 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago, IL 60611-1443
ReviewText: The rooms are too old. The bathroom is too small Room service is fine. The front desk a little bit rude. The view is amazing. The concierge is ok. The laundry service is very bad. The spa is fine. That is all.

ProviderLocation: 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago , IL 60611-1443 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago, IL 60611-1443
ReviewText: Stayed here for 2 nights for my whirlwind visit in the windy city, as always four seasons never disappointed me. I chose this over Park Hyatt as it offers a better view on the famous lake, although both are centrally located on the magnificent mile. The hotel has a couple cafes nearby and its directly connected to the shopping mall. Location wise is outstanding. The minute I stepped into the hotel lobby I was made very welcomed. The front desk staff Mosiz was extremely nice and proactively offered assistance and suggestions to my first time visit in Chicago, and when I called to inquire about the in room quirky noise he was very patient and assured me it was just the wind. The hotel was very kind to provide complimentary coffee and a bakery item as in bed breakfast due to the wind noise. Turn down service was impeccably done and guests could chose the exact time for the service which was good. Bell boys were generally friendly, when I left very early for Boston one of them was nice enought to help me with the luggage and settle in car. I also noticed they provide towels & water at the lobby entrance for morning runners and also tea / coffee at the main reception. In terms of the room, I had a king lake view and it was pretty spacious. The best thing I like there was the different cable heads already plugged in and ready for device charging, it just made life so much easier especially for foreign travellers. Towels were generously provided, the only thing I wish they could work on is to bring in speakers in the bathroom so enjoying TV in bath is better. All in all, was very happy with my stay there and will certainly stay there again on my next visit.

ReviewText: The hotel is nice well maintained and beautiful.the rooms are clean but make a little bit.staffs are very awesome and well care .all are very friendly and helpful.i am a business man so I will com again to visit here for official meeting and I will stay here thank-you all buddies

ProviderLocation: 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago , IL 60611-1443 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago, IL 60611-1443
ReviewText: I stayed in executive suite and it was a wonderful experience. Saw all sides of history in Chicago. Had an interesting run-in at one of the clubs recommended by the hotel staff as well, kind of like Moulin Rouge which is metaphor for Scottish Alex Fleming's search for antibiotics in time to cure his loved one -- in the end, he manages to do it this round, and Penicillin is what ultimately puts to rest the Prussia Nine Bridges of Konigsberg problem -- ask not for whom the Bell tolls, it tolls for thee. Ask not who she loves, she loves thee. Well worth the adventure travel to Chicago. Seeing as Chicago was impressed by the party I saw here of Chasseurs (writers), Chevalier de Ligne (mathematicians), Canon (economists), Fregates (doctors), and Galions (surgeons), next trip here I bring the Cavalier. What a party with this hotel at the center, as it is never about the place, but the people.

ProviderLocation: 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago , IL 60611-1443 120 E. Delaware Pl. , Chicago, IL 60611-1443
ReviewText: The Four Seasons Chicago has all the qualities you would expect from this elegant collection - attentive staff, very comfortable rooms and well-appointed facilities. it's also very central for the main shopping area - and the Newberry Library if you like old books - and an El trip away from the museums. You also appreciate the service when it's needed - for example, the concierge efficiently sorted out multiple air-ticketing disasters. Why choose it? If you want a quiet, secure and agreeable stay with comfort assured. And what could have been better? Well, one or two things. The breakfast was disappointing with juice that wasn't freshly squeezed, under-ripe fruit and not-very-warm hot dishes. The fine swimming pool was also a bit chilly. Perhaps you detect a theme here? And the bar is very Chicago - a bit dark with heavy food; indeed the lighest bite was the hot dog which, characteristically, turned out to be home made and excellent. So, overall, no complaints but one or two things need a quick squiz.

ReviewText: We stayed at Lowes Chicago while in town to see Hamilton. Our visit and the staff at Lowes could not have been better!! I am definitely recommending Lowed Chicago to anyone planning a trip to Chicago.

ProviderLocation: 455 N Park Drive , Chicago , IL 60611-5886 455 N Park Drive , Chicago, IL 60611-5886
ReviewText: Upon arrival there was a $100 deposit. When we entered the room, there was no microwave or fridge, so if you want one you're gonna have to pay 25 or 35 to have it in your room. The complimentary internet doesn't even let you stream Netflix, so if you want netflix you're gonna have to pay $12. Plus the front desk was not very friendly instead judgemental and rude. Initially it was $160, but when I checked out it was around $200 something. Also parking is $40 a night and that's self park. Valet parking would drain your wallet. Would not recommend this hotel due to lack of information and hidden charges.

ProviderLocation: 455 N Park Drive , Chicago , IL 60611-5886 455 N Park Drive , Chicago, IL 60611-5886
ReviewText: Beautiful hotel - great Streeterville location - trendy architecture and interior design. Real nice gym and pool. All personnel encountered very friendly and not pretentious - much appreciated that! Bedroom furniture - not the greatest quality. Other hotels have more comfortable bedding and beds. OK bath amenities. My beef was the pricey bar - at least for the product offered - come on - you can get 14 Hands Merlot for $7.99 / bottle at Trader Joe's and they're charging $18 a glass/$60 bottle! ReviewTitle: Trendy hotel - great location, gym & pool - nice staff - pricey bar for product offered

ProviderLocation: 455 N Park Drive , Chicago , IL 60611-5886 455 N Park Drive , Chicago, IL 60611-5886
ReviewText: Excellent follow through from booking through my stay celebrating an anniversary. Warm & friendly staff, clean, very comfortable bedding, & they even sent a nice hand written card w champagne & strawberries!

ProviderLocation: 455 N Park Drive , Chicago , IL 60611-5886 455 N Park Drive , Chicago, IL 60611-5886
ReviewText: One of the best hotels ever! I don't think I have enough space to list all of great features of this hotel. I had a corner king bed room with floor-to-ceiling windows. Very spacious room. Even though I was only on the 5th floor, my view of the iconic Chicago skyline was unobstructed. The bed was a heavenly dream, so super comfortable and luxurious. The valet parking was smooth and easy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bathroom was beautiful and large, with a wonderful walk-in shower . There was a special "boarding pass" area in the lobby with computers and a printer to easily print your flight boarding pass, saving a lot of stress. Back to the room, besides the bed there are three other comfortable chairs to sit or lounge in. After you enter the room, there is a a built-in table/ledge, great for placing your keys or handbag. There is also a similar ledge//table in the bathroom to neatly hold makeup, deodorant, etc. You know how some rooms seem to be lit only by a 10 watt bulb? Not at Lowes Chicago. here is a stylish floor lamp with three levels of lighting, plus wall lights and table lamps galore. I like a lot of light, and this place has it! The only very minor negatives would be the room service food and minibar selections. Its the same old, same old. Nothing new and exciting. Also, it was sometimes hard to find the elevator. It's a ways away and you have to make a couple of turns. Also, the address doesn't register on a GPS, which can be a problem if you are driving. Back to the positives. Included in the packet with your card keys is a list of the easy options or checking out. Again, little touches take away the stress. I loved my stay at Lowes. Will be my go-to Chicago hotel.

ProviderLocation: 455 N Park Drive , Chicago , IL 60611-5886 455 N Park Drive , Chicago, IL 60611-5886
ReviewText: This is my favorite hotel to get away and have a staycation!!! The service is great and the staff is excellent. I've never had a complaint. I plan on staying again fairly soon. Can't wait! I go to the spa and stay at the hotel and enjoy the roof top!

ReviewTitle: This is a property that gets it.

ReviewText: Rooms are small - think NYC style. Nice and clean. Felt the shower had a poor layout - with low-water pressure... but might just be personal preference. Very nice in-room coffee and tea from local vendor. Location is convenient to Art Institute (0.5 mile). Nice stay. Friendly service. ProviderLocation: 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago , IL 60601-2406 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60601-2406
ReviewText: We stayed at this hotel with a group of friends to celebrate one of our friend's birthdays. What a great hotel! The decor was very modern and unique... it flowed well. And, the service was really high quality too. All of the couples loved this hotel and would definitely recommend it to others!

ProviderLocation: 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago , IL 60601-2406 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60601-2406
ReviewText: This hotel is in a great location downtown. Walking distance to the park, river and Magnificent Mile. We just had the cheapest room available, but it exceeded our expectations. So much thought went into its design. At night, you don't need to look at the clock, the time is projected on the ceiling! The bed and pillows were also on point. Super comfortable! Remember free drinks between 7pm-8pm! It's not great having to pay $65 a day in parking, but it's consistent with other hotels in Chicago.

ProviderLocation: 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago , IL 60601-2406 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60601-2406
ReviewText: Just back from a fantastic trip to Chicago where we had four nights at the Virgin Hotel. First, the positives: 1: What a great location, slap bang in the middle of things. When you walk out in the morning and see the skyscrapers it is almost unreal. 2: The rooms are lovely, very stylish and impeccably clean. 3: The whole place is slightly quirky but in a good way. It is not your typical corporate hotel and we were very pleased with the quality of everything there. There were a small number of things that affected our stay: 1: It is right next to a corner on the Loop. Even though we were on the 16th floor and they provided ear plugs it is a real issue. An additional layer of glass might do the job, alternatively some oil for the trains!!! 2: The staff are picked for their hipster credentials rather than their customer service. I like the typical over the top welcome and hospitality that the Americans do so well. Just felt the staff were more about their piercings, hair and leather than they were about customer service and found them cursory and slightly rude on a couple of occasions. If this is what cool is, then perhaps it isn't for people like me. 3: The roof terrace was closed for all the nights we were there (we arrived very late on the Saturday. Would have appreciated another area to relax but, as it was, the lift won't even allow you to go to the top floor when it isn't open. 4: The mini bar selection was great but it's not the street food prices that I'd read about. Totally appreciate that this is probably necessary but I needed to adjust my expectations after all I'd read. In conclusion. It's a wonderful hotel and I think it sets a new standard in alternative approaches to running hotels but there are a few wrinkles that need ironed out.
ReviewTitle: Very good but a couple of issues that need addressed

ProviderLocation: 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago , IL 60601-2406 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60601-2406
ReviewText: The Virgin Hotel is perfectly located in the Windy City. A block from the river, four blocks from the theater district, the Loop, even the Art Institute. Our room was incredibly, spacious, clean and quiet. The front desk staff wonderfully helpful (helped us acquire tickets for a comedy club, suggested local restaurants and even allowed us a late check out. The hotel is well appointed (your room has everything you could ever need) and the second floor bar and club is a great relaxation stop after a busy day around town. Additionally the room rate was phenomenally low. My new favorite hotel in Chicago.
ReviewTitle: A Terrific Spot in the Windy City

ProviderLocation: 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago , IL 60601-2406 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60601-2406
ReviewText: I paid 135$ a night and for this price the hotel represented amazing value for money. It's in a great location - surrounded by most of the major hotels. The hotel is decorated in a fun and tongue-in-cheek way. It's a pretty old building so has some charm if you like that. The room itself was good, and I liked to convey of mini-bar being reasonably priced. I didn't use many of the hotel amenities but tried the bar and it's pretty amazing they have free drinks between 7-8! The only downside was lack of view and the duvet was so light and came out of the cover. I'd recommend this hotel for groups of friends - it's fun, it's jazzy and it's well priced.
ReviewTitle: Fun and great value for money!

ProviderLocation: 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago , IL 60601-2406 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60601-2406
ReviewText: Rooms are modern, clean, stylised. Restaurant and bars are outstanding, plus happy hour free beverages. Spa has fabulous steam room and wonderful services. Excellent location near blue line train. I went for Hendrix Experience tour at Chicago theater which was a block away. Chicago River and city scape views from room. I look forward to returning. I now measure other Chicago hotels by the Virginia Hotel standards.

ProviderLocation: 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago , IL 60601-2406 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60601-2406
ReviewText: Excellent choice in the Loop. A tad quirky with separate shower and bathrooms, a dog-motif and interesting honor bar with snacks, booze, etc. I liked my stay at the Virgin Hotel Chicago - staff were helpful, the 2nd floor bar area was well-maintained and comfortable. Sleep was good.

ProviderLocation: 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago , IL 60601-2406 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60601-2406
ReviewText: A wonderful hotel with great rooms a beautiful view and lots of class for half the price. Wether your traveling not just would like to pamper your loved one the Virgin Hotels is the place to be. I will definitely stay at this lovely hotel again very soon. Thanks Virgin Hotels for the wonderful stay.

ProviderLocation: 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago , IL 60601-2406 203 N Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60601-2406
ReviewText: Well this is a truly amazing hotel. I have never been to a hotel where every single member of staff has been so very friendly and appear to really enjoy working here. Where to begin.... I arrived about 7.45pm. They have a bar called Commons Club where drinks and cocktails are served free of charge to all guests between 7/8pm. Snacks available to buy. I was told to go straight up and have a drink - music to my ears! My room was lovely. As you walk into the room it is really 1 large room that can be divided into 2 with sliding doors. First is the dressing room area, bathroom and huge shower. Some of the lights come on automatically which can be a pain if you get up in the night for a pee and don't want to put the light on so you don't really wake up! I am a light sleeper and it's right on top of The Loop (train) and the noise kept me awake - that must be why there were ear plugs in the room! However in the morning they changed my room to a much higher floor and to the back of the hotel. I could still hear the train but I really can't reduce my rating of this hotel because everything else about it was so good and I expect most people wouldn't even notice the noise. They have a hostess who walks around and is their Woman in Red (Virgin brand) however i still think she should be called Lady in Red. The hotel has a house car - a Tesla - available to drive guests anywhere within a 2 miles radius from 8/11am and 4/8pm. I mostly travel alone and have been made to feel so very welcome here with staff coming up to me to check I'm ok all the time. I can't name them all because there are so many but Ray, Thadius, Marguerite, Zac, Xavier, James are some of the guys I have met who have been super nice. I am sure I have forgotten something but I expect you are bored by now so here are a couple of photos of my room plus one from my first room showing how near the train is. My tip is to ask for an upper floor and one facing the back of the hotel if you are a light sleeper. Great hotel with The Best Staff.
ReviewTitle: My first time staying this side of the river

ReviewText: My wife and I enjoyed outstanding accommodations with wonderful amenities at the Waldorf Astoria. The upscale 900 Shops are across the street from the hotel and so are several fine dining restaurants. The Original Pancake House is only two block away -- don't miss it!
ReviewTitle: Blown Away in the Windy City

ProviderLocation: 11 East Walton , Chicago , IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago) 11 East Walton , Chicago, IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago)
ReviewText: The Waldorf Astoria Chicago on Walton is one of my all time favorite hotels and the best for a staycation over the holidays. The service is impeccable. The Astoria suite w/ fireplace and terrace is 915 sq ft and perfect size for 2. The bathroom has a wonderful large soaking tub with a TV in the mirror which makes for a great relaxing soak. There is a separate shower and toilet, nice for privacy. There are his and hers closets with plenty of drawer space. The spa is amazing - a great spot whether staying at the hotel or enjoying a relaxing spa day int he city. Bernard's is worth the meal or a drink at the bar and I am especially fond of their weekend brunch. In room dining - try their cheese and charcuterie, heirloom beet salad, and braised beef short rib. The best shopping in Chicago is right out the door...Barney's, Prada, St. Laurent and wonderful restaurants in Gold Coast. The Waldorf Astoria Chicago is a must stay!
ReviewTitle: Always elegant with great service, Chicago's Walforf

ProviderLocation: 11 East Walton , Chicago , IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago) 11 East Walton , Chicago, IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago)
ReviewText: We love the Waldorf Astoria Chicago so much that we do staycations (we live in Chicago) at the hotel! The rooms are beautiful and spacious and the location is perfect, as it's in right downtown Chicago. The staff is always friendly and anything you could possibly need is at the hotel. The only downfall is that the snacks in the room as well as spa services are on the high end of pricing, but this is how most luxurious hotels are. If you have the funds, definitely stay here when visiting Chicago! The spa and gym facility is amazing as well.

ProviderLocation: 11 East Walton , Chicago , IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago) 11 East Walton , Chicago, IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago)
ReviewText: In the middle of the active Gold Coast, I can find my Oasis. Exceptional staff, the hotel is beautiful. Common areas are small, but the rooms are large and very well appointed. The Spa is great! Love the steam room, hot tub and rainfall showers. All interactions with staff were very professional and staff is well trained and empowered to make decisions, also knowledgeable.
