Only issue, is that the courtyard drive up gets congested, so I pick my uber on the street, but this is no big deal.

ProviderLocation: 11 East Walton , Chicago , IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago) 11 East Walton , Chicago, IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago)
ReviewText: When you ask for the 5 star experience this hotel goes beyond the term. From the hospitality of the staff, to the great selection of food from the amazing restaurant, it has it all. If your looking for time at the spa or nearby shopping and attractions there's not one better place to stay at!

ProviderLocation: 11 East Walton , Chicago , IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago) 11 East Walton , Chicago, IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago)
ReviewText: This was my first stay with Waldorf Astoria and slightly more than I wanted to spend, $500 with tax. Overall it was worth the price for impeccable service, a 5bstar where everbody is treated well is a huge selling factor. The room was spacious, maintained very well and the accommodations at the spa were unbelievable. I hated leaving.

ProviderLocation: 11 East Walton , Chicago , IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago) 11 East Walton , Chicago, IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago)
ReviewText: After a very stressful return trip from the East Coast, I stayed at my favorite Chicago hotel for a relaxing solo visit. My room was upgraded at check-in, which placed me in a beautiful relaxing room with a warm, toasty fireplace! I LOVE this hotel!!

ProviderLocation: 11 East Walton , Chicago , IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago) 11 East Walton , Chicago, IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago)
ReviewText: Where else can you find warm, personalized elegant service in a stunning, sparkling and glamorous architectural gem? In Chicago's gold coast near to the best shopping in the city and within a block of the renown Magnificent Mile The Waldorf Astoria is perfectly located. The understated and clean lines of the rooms contrast with the luxury of the mosaic and crystal bathrooms with large wonderful tubs and walk in shower. The staff from doormen, desk personnel, waiters and housekeepers are very efficient, friendly and exceed expectations on a regular basis. Room service is fast and delicious. The gratis Wifi and flat screen LG TVs have a zillion channels and movies, even hidden in the bathroom mirror for those of you who like to watch TV and soak at the same time. The spa and pool are lovely, a real oasis. Can't wait to see the new lobby cafe.

ProviderLocation: 11 East Walton , Chicago , IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago) 11 East Walton , Chicago, IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago)
ReviewText: I have to update my review because the WHOLE PLACE--restaurant scene is ABSOLUTELY GONE. I was astonished that there is NO lobby breakfast or meal possibility--just lite bite breakfast. And.....IF you think of any other meal, prepare to feel like you're in the dining cart of an Amtrak. You can take in a full priced meal in the 1/4 spaced bar area and it's just a cramped--negligible atmosphere. I am not giving a bad review. They are renovating. I used to go to the venue and if felt like LUXURY through and through which is why I SO ranted and raved. But,of someone shows up there now they will not see any thing even remotely similar to what I described previously. The whole lux of the place is...gone

ProviderLocation: 11 East Walton , Chicago , IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago) 11 East Walton , Chicago, IL 60611-1412 (Formerly Elysian Hotel Chicago)
ReviewText: I have always had a great experience at this hotel! The rooms are lovely and I definitely recommend the room with the gas fireplace, it is so luxurious and super nice to have on a cold day. The rooms are the cleanest EVER. The service is amazing, everyone takes such great care of you. The food is awesome at the restaurant too and great bar service. This location is awesome too as it's right near shopping and great restaurants. I always look forward to staying at Waldorf's and it's always worth the price for the experience one receives. I just love this hotel and will be back next week!

ProviderLocation: 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60603 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60603
ReviewText: Had a pretty splendid experience here as some first timers. Flew in randomly with my wife and my dog Braxie for my birthday. We spent some time with my family from Evanston and went dancing at a few places around the city. I've always heard of the athletic club but never knew it was a hotel. Isiah and Floor and all the people at the front desk and lobby where very helpful and recommended some cool places for us to check out. Everyone loved Brax and Fred gave us a couple of cool CAA cookies for Brax that my wife really seemed like she wanted to eat (maybe she did). This place was packed our entire stay so don't let the pictures on the website fool you, even the reading room is loud, this hotel was one big party and we loved it.
ReviewTitle: Chillaxing with my wife and the Braxton

ProviderLocation: 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60603 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60603
ReviewText: Stayed only 2 nights but would have loved to stay a few more! This was a hotel I found on a Trip Advisor Search and am glad I did! Right across from Millenium Park we had a room with a view of the park. The room was comfortable, the bathroom large. The food options at the hotel are plentiful and prices are on par with the rest of the city. IF there is one knock, the sheets on our bed were ripped as was the comforter and the smells from Shake Shack do pervade the 5th floor. But those are not huge things.
ReviewTitle: Great Stay in a Great Location

ProviderLocation: 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60603 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60603
ReviewText: This was a cool experience - the venue is a blast from the past. We had fun hanging out at the hotel, reading in the drawing room, playing chess in the game room. Coffee was good in the morning, Milk Room, Cherry Circle Room, and Cindy's were lovely places to hang out. Service was great. Just a fun way to spend a few days experiencing something out of the ordinary. Definitely gets packed at night, so hard to take advantage of the games at that point.

ProviderLocation: 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60603 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60603
ReviewText: Stayed for two nights on a weekend that happened to be one of the warmest weekends in the last hundred years. This is a beautiful, chic, dreamy hotel where everything has been designed and crafted with consideration.

ProviderLocation: 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60603 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60603
ReviewText: Beautiful hotel. Unique. Delicious food in the cherry circle restaurant. Really fun game room. Lobby great place to have a drink. Perfect location. Comfortable clean rooms, also unique and interesting.
ReviewTitle: Fun place to spend an afternoon.

ProviderLocation: 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60603 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60603
ReviewText: Having stayed at many of the premier Chicago hotels, my experience with boutique hotels has been mixed. I felt I received more for my money at the big international brand hotels. My experience with the CAA Hotel was excellent and for what you have available to you and your location, it's a pretty strong bargain ! My checking was the long Presidents Day weekend where unusually warm and sunny weather dominated. The hotel, with its prime rooftop restaurant overlooking Millennium Park, was full of people taking advantage of the weather. Many hotels can be overwhelmed by this - but my check in was smooth and my room was ready earlier than expected. My room, overlooking Millennium Park was well appointed and comfortable. As is typical in old building rehabs, the rooms aren't large but they were laid out well/ Easily comfortable for two people. My meals at the Cherry Circle Room and Cindy's were very good. Will gladly revisit them even if I'm not staying at the hotel. A mark down for room service though. I found room service meals to be inconsistent - some were ok, some were sub par. The CAA Hotels location to Millennium Park, the Art Institute and Museum Campus area, and its great views are really hard to beat. I will definitely return.
ReviewTitle: Great hotel in the perfect location

ProviderLocation: 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60603 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60603
ReviewText: Beautifully restored the CAA hotel is lovely to visit. I had a small room at the back of the hotel that was well appointed but rather uninspiring. The air was stale, smelled like old bedroom, and the heating.air conditioning was not effective in getting the air to circulate and maintain a temp below 69 degrees. It was very clean and tidy and the mini bar well stocked but very pricey. Housekeeping staff were incredibly friendly, as was the wait staff at Cindys.

ProviderLocation: 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60603 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60603
ReviewText: This is an updated review from my stay last week at the Chicago Athletic Association Hotel. After being disappointed with my room and mentioning so in my review, I was immediately contacted by Management who personally tended to my concerns and made sure the rest of my stay was comfortable and enjoyable. The staff here is top notch, friendly and attentive. The lobby is beautiful and a great place to work or chill out for a bit. The restaurants are lively and the speakeasy is charming. The location could not be better. The rooms were quiet, which is no easy feat in any hotel and the gym had new equipment, good free weights and ample mats, medicine balls, bosu, etc. The reason for four instead of five stars has only to do with my preference for aesthetics in the rooms. The décor is very much aligned with the history of the hotel, but I just prefer a more elegant design. Nonetheless, for all other reasons mentioned, especially the attentive service- I would stay again!
ReviewTitle: Excellent Customer Service and Beautiful Restoration, Prime location!!

ProviderLocation: 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60603 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60603
ReviewText: Location, ambience, comfortable & easily manageable room layout along with excellent staff service make this hotel unbeatable. The Cindy restaurant on the 13th floor that provides a panoramic view of the lakefront that is unrivaled with food & beverage selections which will not disappoint. So well done, you'll find reasons to return ...

ProviderLocation: 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago , IL 60603 12 South Michigan Avenue , Chicago, IL 60603
ReviewText: Other reviews mention the "coolness" factor and the fact that it's a "hot spot for the 35 and under crowd". This is true. The convenience factor of this hotel is off the charts; perfect location. My room was very nice but was right next to alley where I had to listen to what sounded like a garbage truck for 20 minutes. I figured they were picking up trash from the hotel but, at 11:00 pm? That was my first night there. On my second night there, room service mistakenly knocked on my door at 1:00 am. Since I was by myself in the room, I did not open door. They knocked a 2nd time even louder and said "room service". I got up an yelled through the door (since I was in my underwear) that I didn't order anything. Cindy's on the top floor boasts a sensational view and it just so happened that it was in the 60's on 1/21/17 when I was there and I was able to enjoy this view and sit on the patio that overlooks Millennium Park. However, the menu is VERY limited and I had an $15.00 BLT which was underwhelming (to say the least). It had hardly any bacon on it. With so many hotels to choose from in Chicago, it's not likely that I would choose to stay here again.
ReviewTitle: Lovely but, wouldn't stay here again.

ProviderLocation: 505 North State Street , Chicago , IL 60654-4803 505 North State Street , Chicago, IL 60654-4803
ReviewText: 4 nights at the Palomar Chicago just wasn't enough. From check in to check out our experience was 5* all the way. The room: Room 1504 was one of the hotel's "King Spa Premier" rooms. The bed was very comfortable with quality and spotless linens. The room was a good size with a seating area (desk, couch, chair and table) as well as the sleeping area. Our room was a corner room so we had two sided views to the south and east. The bathroom was GREAT. The two person jetted spa tub really does fit two people, the shower has great pressure, is high enough for the 6'6" types and is done up with high quality finishes. The bath products were of high quality. Housekeeping managed to keep this huge bathroom (as well as the rest of the room and hotel) spotless. Easier said than done; kudos to them. It should also be noted that this is one of the quietest rooms I've ever been in even though it had floor to ceiling windows over busy Chicago on two sides. The hallway noise was minimal, the outside noise was non-existent and it gave the room an oasis-like feel. This is a HUGE plus for those of us getting away from kids and noise for a few days. Ammenities: A cold snap prevented us from taking advantage of the roof top al fresco area but I'd bet that in July that spot is as nice as it gets; the lobby lounge area is well appointed with comfortable seating and a large area for many groups. 5pm is free wine hour with new labels daily. Free coffee and tea reside in the wine's spot every morning as well. Staff: The front desk staff was friendly, professional and knowledgable. Very helpful with directions, extra towels, etc... The door staff was above and beyond what one would expect. Friendly, professional, likeable and knowledgable (restaurants, bars, directions, where to avoid, who to see, etc). I cannot speak highly enough of them; they were as good as, if not better than, any front desk/bell staff I've ever encountered. Location: Far enough from Michigan Ave to seem less touristy but right in the middle of the action. A perfect location as far as I'm concerned. $30 Uber to/from O'Hare, $10 to Au Cheval, $11 to Hamilton/Privatebank Theatre. Thanks again to the whole staff at the Palomar; we look forward to our next visit.

ProviderLocation: 505 North State Street , Chicago , IL 60654-4803 505 North State Street , Chicago, IL 60654-4803
ReviewText: Love this hotel. Great location, great staff. They really seem to try to personalize your experience. Was here for a birthday weekend. Julian was amazing, and I can not thank him enough for all he did for us. Especially after an incident that happened in another part of the city. Back at the hotel he was very helpful. I will for sure be back again next time I am in Chicago!

ProviderLocation: 505 North State Street , Chicago , IL 60654-4803 505 North State Street , Chicago, IL 60654-4803
ReviewText: There are a lot of options in Chicago, and we chose Palomar because it had good reviews. The location is good being near bars and restaurants. The staff was friendly. The room reminded me of a Las Vegas room because it had an interesting patterned carpet, and because our curtains were ripped in a few places (like many people stay here and it's a little worn). The room was clean and the linens were nice. It was nice enough.

ProviderLocation: 505 North State Street , Chicago , IL 60654-4803 505 North State Street , Chicago, IL 60654-4803
ReviewText: Stay here last night...had tickets to Hamilton and we wanted to stay north of the river. Also lots of shopping and food within a short walk. LOVED this property......sleek, clean, fantastic customer service, 2 minute check-in, good food at Sable and yummy room service breakfast. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

ProviderLocation: 505 North State Street , Chicago , IL 60654-4803 505 North State Street , Chicago, IL 60654-4803
ReviewText: I had a great stay at the Hotel Palomar! Swanky interior, friendly staff, reasonable prices- it was a great choice! I felt really well taken care of; particularly by Mark and Sam in the morning and Marc and Miguel on the night shift. They were all accommodating, friendly, and made me feel welcome. We were walking distance to RPM, a great steak house. The rooftop lap pool was awesome. It was great a stay, thanks so much!
ReviewTitle: Extra care from the staff made my trip Extra-ordinary

ProviderLocation: 505 North State Street , Chicago , IL 60654-4803 505 North State Street , Chicago, IL 60654-4803
ReviewText: Just has an AWESOME experience at the Hotel Palomar this past weekend. I was downtown for a Wilco Winterlude show, and the staff of the Palomar rocked almost as hard as Tweedy and Co! Close to everything, super friendly staff, cool property, and the bed was super comfy in one of the CLEANEST hotel rooms I have ever stayed at. Highly recommend staying here! ROCK ON PALOMAR!

ProviderLocation: 505 North State Street , Chicago , IL 60654-4803 505 North State Street , Chicago, IL 60654-4803
ReviewText: I stayed here one night in December. I ended up using my free night reward with my Kimpton Karma rewards. I found a parking garage nearby and check in was seamless. I loved the room. It was so comfortable. I ended up getting room service and I enjoyed that as well. I didn't do much walking around the neighborhood. Overall it was an excellent stay.

ProviderLocation: 505 North State Street , Chicago , IL 60654-4803 505 North State Street , Chicago, IL 60654-4803
ReviewText: Dear Audience if you are confused with my title just know this is perhaps my most favorite hotel in Chicago and for very very good reasons! I stay here or at least try and find time to stay at the Palomar at least twice a month if I am in Illinois and since I have been back here in Illinois for quite some time this review is about my stay during one of our blizzards during January where Aretha Franklin was forced to cancer her concert and this review is based on my most recent stay yesterday. First of all try and visit Chicago during our worst weather seasons because the Palomar is a "treat" and you will fall in love with the Staff. Mark has known me for quite some time now and not only is he genuinely kind and enthusiastic but he has a great knowledge of the city of Chicago and will help you plan something special. Sam also works at the front desk and she is genuinely kind as she greets you in at check in and check out. Honestly the staff here at this location is some of the friendliest and they are quite good at what they do. During January's blizzard the rates here dropped and I scheduled a spa room with a tub for two as a treat and of course if you come here please do not miss wine hour because wine hour at the Palomar is special. The guests congregate in the comfortable living room area with comfortable couches and a cozy fireplace to get wine, water and flat bread. You will not wish to miss the flat bread because it's so delicious and you can also order an entire flat bread at their restaurant Sable which I love visiting on the ground floor. All the rooms here are cozy but the premier spa suites with a view are the most beautiful and the jacuzzi tubs are so huge you can actually sink down into them with water hitting your neck. There is so much room in the tubs you can fit a total of THREE people in there so if you want to have a romantic evening with your partner I do recommend the spa rooms with the jacuzzi jet tubs. Sable is relaxing and the chef might even visit your table if it's quiet. During the blizzard in January the chef did come to my table and rewarded me with a complimentary dessert to try for being an inner circle member. I decided to try a small sampling of everything so I decided on the tiny portion of chicken and waffles which were so delicious and served with home made maple syrup and I sampled their heavy macaroni and cheese and topped off my meal with truffle fries. I must say I made some excellent choices and I will be back for seconds soon! The dessert was a deconstructed sweet potato pie that came in layers and was so rich and filling I had to take half of it upstairs with me to my room to eat while I picked out a movie to watch. There are so many good movies to choose from so you can relax in your room, nibble on good food and watch the newest movies going on in all the theaters. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and their wonderful staff so I am just going to end this review by encouraging everyone visiting Chicago to pick the Palomar not only for its great location but because it's luxurious without being stuffy and you will feel like it's your second home.
ReviewTitle: Decadence, comfort, Coziness, charming spa like Oasis

ProviderLocation: 505 North State Street , Chicago , IL 60654-4803 505 North State Street , Chicago, IL 60654-4803
ReviewText: I'm very glad I chose this hotel for my short visit to Chicago. It has the best possible location, between Magnificent Mile upscale shopping area and southern part with parks and museums. There's a lot of places to eat around, a supermarket and also an upscale mall across the street. The area is full of people, so you feel safe even later in the evening. The Chicago river with its walks and sightseeings is a couple of blocks away. My basic room was very spacious and also very cosy at the same time. I wouldn't mind staying in the whole time. It was very quiet. Everything was squeaky clean, the room smelled fresh, there was plenty of high quality bathroom amenities. Wifi was good, hotel staff was helpful but not intrusive.

ProviderLocation: 505 North State Street , Chicago , IL 60654-4803 505 North State Street , Chicago, IL 60654-4803
ReviewText: The Palomar is a modern sleek hotel in the very popular Near North area of downtown Chicago. It's located conveniently close to the Loop and the Magnificent Mile shopping area. It's also close to the Red line el train. The hotel seems to be in a new building (as of Dec. 2016 when I'm writing this) which also is a condo or apartment building. It's located close to so many restaurants and bars. This is a big plus! I had a "View" room, however, the view wasn't that great. My room faced West which yields a very unglamorous view of lower-level uninteresting buildings to the west of downtown. I didn't have a view I of the core downtown or river that I was anticipating. My room was very clean and modern. It's so modern that it took me a white to figure out how to turn on the lights. I did appreciate the design of the room and the furniture. Due to the busy-ness of the hotel (i was there the weekend before Christmas), I always had to wait for an elevator. Many times I was on the elevator, the bell captains would push the heavy-laden luggage carts onto the elevator with their departing guests. I was amazed at how many people still use bell captains these days! The front-desk staff was very friendly and cordial upon check-in and check-out. Also, the check-in/out process was pretty quick and efficient, too. A major plus! The Wi-Fi signal was pretty strong. However, since it is an un-secure connection, I couldn't browse several sites on my updated iOS and macOS devices (I hadn't had this experience before, so I'm wondering if recent updates to iOS and macOS prevent using the internet if on an un-secure network). I didn't take advantage of the free happy hour during the evenings. Since the hotel is so close to many great Chicago bars and restaurants, I was usually out at a nearby tavern for happy hour. :-) I used to stay at Kimpton's Burnham Hotel which I liked quite a bit more. However, Kimpton sold that property and it is now another hotel chain. I'm honestly not sure I'd stay at the Palomar again. There's really nothing wrong with the hotel. Perhaps I was expecting better views out the windows. Views usually aren't a big deal for me - but in a city like Chicago with all the spectacular architecture, I was hoping for something more. Perhaps other rooms in the hotel have windows facing the core downtown or, maybe even, the Lake. Give the Palomar a try.
ReviewTitle: Good hotel in a choice location in downtown Chicago

ProviderLocation: 10 S Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60603 (Formerly The Silversmith Hotel & Suites)
ReviewText: I felt like I walked into a well designed jewelry box. Loved hangning out in the lobby with the well done library. Got a coffee across the street and chilled out while waiting for my taxi. Everything from the wallpaper to the light fixtures to the art is so well done! ( I took notes for future remodels.) Staff is friendly and helpful, gave us an umbrella to use to walk to our dinner a block away, the rain and wind kicked on just as we were walking out. Room we had was marvelous with a purple loungey couch to watch movies on, bed was fabulous and fluffy, fridge in room was handy and the Keurig! In room!! No more sweat sock coffee-hallelujah! Molton Brown room treats and the spa robe iced the cake for me. Coordinated well with my icelandic spa kit I bought at Sephora. With in walking distance to all kinds of good things-Macy's, Art Museum, the Bean, record store, Mertz Apothocary, oh and how can if forget Nando's right NEXT DOOR. We parked the car for three days and called it good. Excellent get away would stay again.
ReviewTitle: Luxury Capsule with in room Keurig

ProviderLocation: 10 S Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60603 (Formerly The Silversmith Hotel & Suites)
ReviewText: We booked last minute, and got an out of season bargain. On arrival, we were then "double-upgraded". We had a room overlooking Wabash Avenue, but there was no noise from the trains or traffic due to good insulation. There were also heavy blackout curtains which made the room cosy and warm during the cold weather. The bed was football pitch sized, warm and clean, with wonderful pillows. The room, as well as the rest of the hotel is decorated in shades of grey, silver, white and grey with splashes of mustard yellow, purple and puce. The lighting is imaginative and reflects the light in interesting ways. Our room had two TVs, a sofa and a fridge, but no mini-bar. Ice was available on request. I wonder if this would be different during peak season. There is also a safe. The bathroom was clean and modern, with plenty of lovely white towels and there were two luxurious robes. However, the shower was a little disappointing, with a trickle rather than a shower. Being short, I had to dodge about to get wet... The lobby, bar and restaurant are outstanding examples of Art Deco flamboyance, and immaculately clean. Reception and door staff are welcoming, friendly and attentive. We had cocktails in the bar one night which was a little sparse (not really surprising for a Tuesday in February), but the young bar tender was again friendly and attentive. We didn't eat in the restaurant so can't comment on the food for dinner or breakfast. We ate breakfast out, as it appears to be cheaper. The one weird thing is the gaps under the bedroom doors to the corridor...draughty and let in light and noise...

ProviderLocation: 10 S Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60603 (Formerly The Silversmith Hotel & Suites)
ReviewText: Enjoyed our stay here very much. The hotel is updated and very nice. Rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. Great location close to the Art Institute of Chicago and Millennium Park and many other things within walking distance and also close to the train. The staff here was great. Very attentive and helpful. We were given very early check-in which was great. The restaurant and the bar area looked nice but we didn't have the opportunity to visit either one. Maybe next time.

ProviderLocation: 10 S Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60603 (Formerly The Silversmith Hotel & Suites)
ReviewText: I paid for a king size bed but got a double bed. Not cool... The location is great, walking distance to many places. Nice bathroom. Nice staff, but the room is tiny and we don't see the furniture that was in the management photos (individual sofa)

ProviderLocation: 10 S Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60603 (Formerly The Silversmith Hotel & Suites)
ReviewText: Loved the location. The best thing that stood out the most about this beautiful hotel was the friendliness of the staff, especially Patty at the front desk. I felt she went above and beyond. The entire staff was very nice and courteous.

ProviderLocation: 10 S Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60603 (Formerly The Silversmith Hotel & Suites)
ReviewText: I recently journeyed to Chicago to hear some music. The music was at Symphony Hall, and I took the train there, so I wanted a room downtown. I selected Silversmith from the description, location, and price. I was more than pleasantly surprised when I arrived: first class lobby, doorman, and front desk personnel. I took the elevator up to the room, and the room was excellent; large/comfortable bed, nice furniture, deluxe bathroom, gratis bottled water, and a nice bathrobe to wear during my visit. This will be my go-to for future visits to Chicago. A++
ReviewTitle: Recent visit to Chicago: Silversmith Hotel

ProviderLocation: 10 S Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60603 (Formerly The Silversmith Hotel & Suites)
ReviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location for exploring Chicago. If you go to United Center, therevisva bus stop nearbs. You can walk ro Soldier field from there. The lady, who was checking me in was great and very helpful. Room size was very good. Bed and shower were great. There are two points I didn't like. They offer free wifi, but make you pay for faster internet. I don't get this concept. Why not fast internet for everybody? Then the housekeepin was not good. Instead of replacing the used towels, they were just piled up. Obviously a mistake from housekeepng. overall I liked ir and might return.

ProviderLocation: 10 S Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60603 (Formerly The Silversmith Hotel & Suites)
ReviewText: Came to Chicago to visit my family and continue celebrating the Cubs win. I originally planned to stay at the Blackstone which is my normal hang out but the rates were outrageous. I found the Silversmith on TripAdvisor and thought the location would be perfect. I was kind of concerned about the construction going on in front of the hotel but it was not a problem and I never even heard it once Inside the Hotel. This place is amazing! I am a stickler for cleanliness in this Hotel checks all the boxes. It is beautifully designed with Sleek lines and a modern touch. The rooms are a good size and and the bathrooms are amazing. Everything is so open and bright. The lounge/bar and restaurant area was very nice also there were areas where you can sit comfortably in cushy couches or chairs or sit around the bar. I did not get to eat in the restaurant but it seems like it gets really busy and people were making reservations. They have a happy hour between 5 and 8 on weekdays with really great specials. Another really important factor is how the staff treat you there. They greet you when you come off of the elevator and are very attentive to your needs. Location is excellent. It is a block away from Michigan Avenue and across the street from Buckingham Fountain and Grant Park. The hotel is a couple of blocks east of State Street where there is great shopping. The area has endless restaurant options and a Starbucks right on the corner which is imperative... I got a great rate when booking on TripAdvisor. There was a 48 hour special which worked out very well. They also had a special going on for Cubs fans but it wasn't available on my dates of stay. I also got upgraded to a higher floor when I checked in which was nice. This hotel has no views so if you're looking for that it's not the place to stay, but everything else there makes up for that. I will be visiting Chicago more often in the near future for some business and personal reasons and I definitely plan on staying here if not with family.

ProviderLocation: 10 S Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60603 (Formerly The Silversmith Hotel & Suites)
ReviewText: I stayed at the Silversmith during Lollapalooza and it was perfect. It was nice that there was a special rate offered for this festival. The hotel is luxurious and I enjoyed my large suite. The view from my room wasn't fantastic but I did not mind as I was within walking distance of multiple restaurants and Grant Park. The hotel was quiet and felt like a retreat in the middle of the city. Would definitely stay there again.

ProviderLocation: 10 S Wabash Ave , Chicago, IL 60603 (Formerly The Silversmith Hotel & Suites)
ReviewText: The location of this hotel could not have been more perfect. There is currently construction going on right outside but, it doesn't affect the hotel itself. You are one block from Millennium Park and a few blocks away from the riverwalk. I travel to Chicago frequently and enjoy early morning walks/runs around the lakefront and The Silversmith was in the perfect area for this. Close to coffee shops, restaurants, etc. as well so you don't need to walk far to get anything. I typically am traveling solo to Chicago so it gave me piece of mind that in order to use the elevator at the hotel you must use your room key. A little thing like that goes a long way. I was worried that my room wouldn't be ready as I was checking in early for the WS but, surprisingly, it was! The front desk was very friendly, hospitable and knowledgeable. The doorman were friendly and responsive as well. The room itself (417) was comfortable! I booked it last minute via expedia and got a steal of a deal but that came at the cost of not having a view. Outside the window was another building, no view at all but, when you book last minute and take the first room you can get this is the trade off. I wasn't in the room often so not a big deal. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was spacious, the room itself could have easily accommodated two people. My only con? The walls seemed to be a bit thin. On the last night there I could hear the TV of the room next to me, nothing too crazy loud but it was on all night. When someone shut their door at the room near mine that was also a bit loud and seemed like someone was trying to open the door to mine. Other than that, I would stay here again! (only next time I'll book a room with a better view on a longer stay)

Room was clean and seemed updated. My only complaint is having only one regular coffee in the room. Will stay at this location when we return to Chicago!

ProviderName: Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown/River North
ProviderLocation: 60 W Illinois St , Chicago , IL 60654-4805 60 W Illinois St , Chicago, IL 60654-4805
ReviewText: This hotel was great from the minute we checked in to the minute we checked out. Super friendly staff. Breakfast was very good with a lot of options. Rooms were clean and beds were comfy. We especially liked how there was so many pillows. Walking distance to many restaurants, bars, shopping and site seeing. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. Also to recognize a few: Stephanie at the front desk was such a sweetheart and provided us extraordinary service. During breakfast Javier was so nice and very accommodating. Both are an asset to the company.

ProviderName: Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown/River North

ReviewText: I booked this hotel based on its location, without doing any research, and loved it!! Favorite features: Bathroom, Breakfast, Staff, & Modern Feel Bathroom: Was 1/3 of our room. From the furniture to the art, was very impressed with hotel.

ProviderName: Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown/River North
ProviderLocation: 60 W Illinois St , Chicago , IL 60654-4805 60 W Illinois St , Chicago, IL 60654-4805
ReviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago, Downtown/River North. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The property and rooms are clean, great breakfast dining room & food. Best workout facility I've seen in any hotel.
ReviewTitle: Great place to stay in Downtown Chicago

ProviderName: Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown/River North
ProviderLocation: 60 W Illinois St , Chicago , IL 60654-4805 60 W Illinois St , Chicago, IL 60654-4805
ReviewText: This hotel has a really good version of the standard Fairfield Inn breakfast -- well prepared, organized and stocked. The staff are great -- warm and friendly. The rooms come with ear plugs, which are awesome if you aren't used to being right across from a fire station. The location is really close to the red line and bus transportation and the shopping action in the area. I had a great stay and would choose this hotel again.

ProviderName: Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown/River North
ProviderLocation: 60 W Illinois St , Chicago , IL 60654-4805 60 W Illinois St , Chicago, IL 60654-4805
ReviewText: So, this would be the best place while staying in Chicago. Stayed for 3 days in October and I was so glad I picked this Hotel. First, the location is prime, period. The area is safe, loaded with restaurants, bars, shops, the "L" is just 2 blocks away, just everything you need. Situated right across from a Chicago Firehouse (Engine 42) which makes this really cool. No, it's wasn't loud and yes, I slept like a baby on the 11th floor facing the firehouse. Really cool watching the trucks and seeing the fireman hanging outside. The hotel is SPOTLESS, staff is very professional and wait on you hand & foot. No joke. They genuine want to make you happy and take care of your every need. The check in was fast, efficient & flawless. My King suite was absolutely perfect. As I said, room was spotless and has all that you need. Comfy bed, Free Wi-Fi, microwave, coffee pot, little refrigerator, hairdryer, ironing board, 2 flat screen T.V.'s, couch, desk... etc. The complimentary breakfast is excellent and the staff were OUTSTANDING, you gotta see it. Javier & Brian were the absolutely best. The price was great & again, the location is prime. You won't go wrong staying here.
ReviewTitle: Location, Location, Location!!! Believe The Reviews!!

Great recommendations for eating from staff.

ProviderName: Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown/River North
ProviderLocation: 60 W Illinois St , Chicago , IL 60654-4805 60 W Illinois St , Chicago, IL 60654-4805
ReviewText: Just returned home after a two night stay in this hotel.  The staff at the front desk and in the breakfast room are helpful and friendly, the hotel is clean, and the bathroom in our room was recently redone.  This hotel is in a fantastic location and our room was upgraded upon check in.

ProviderLocation: 20 W Kinzie St , Chicago, IL 60654-6392
ReviewText: Great location. King suite is worth the extra $. Free breakfast, evening cocktails, nice staff. I spend a lot of time (sometimes too much) on looking up hotels. This is a great one to just book and be done. Will be a go-to place next time.

ProviderLocation: 20 W Kinzie St , Chicago, IL 60654-6392
ReviewText: Robert Jones is excellent. He listens well and meets all the needs of the traveler. We have deemed this our "go to" hotel when we don't want to return home to our Chicago suburb home. The pricing is wonderful which includes complimentary happy hour and a breakfast. It's conveniently located to theaters and wonderful restaurants. After enjoying Hamilton last night, it was wonderful to relax and enjoy the suite last evening. Please visit this hotel, you won't be disappointed.

ProviderLocation: 20 W Kinzie St , Chicago, IL 60654-6392
ReviewText: Stayed at The Kinzie Hotel last weekend and it is a great boutique hotel in the heart of Chicago. The staff was so friendly and personable. LOVED the 6th floor for Happy Hour and it was packed!! fun way to meet new people.

ProviderLocation: 20 W Kinzie St , Chicago, IL 60654-6392
ReviewText: Where do I even begin?! This hotel was so accommodating and pleasant I'm already checking my calendar to see when I'll be in Chicago again. I originally booked through booking.com back in September 2016 when I found out there was a concert in Chicago on my boyfriends birthday. I called the hotel a week later to let them know we were coming in for my boyfriends birthday and he was also born on Valentine's Day and I was wondering if they did anything special or if there were any packages. Without hesitation the person I spoke to on the phone upgraded our room and arranged for wine to be sent up to our room! I was so happy! I couldn't believe it! I wanted the room to be a surprise for my boyfriend but we are really bad at keeping secrets so I told him and he got super excited! We are originally from Michigan and we didn't know if it would be cheaper to take the train or to drive so my dad helped me out and he called the hotel and they mentioned if I book through them, they would give me the same room, same deal and they would discount parking for our entire stay. I spoke to Robert from Kinzie Hotel that night and he was so sweet and so nice. Everything that he said would be apart of our stay was so awesome! I felt like a celebrity! He was helpful, he was calm when I got a tiny bit agitated because I wanted this birthday to be perfect and I was getting a little stressed out. After our phone call I was confident that this trip was going to be unforgettable. I stayed in contact with the hotel via email and they responded to my emails very quickly, even at 2 am! Now, to our hotel room. I couldn't believe it. It had a living room and a bedroom, two tv's a spacious bathroom with a vanity mirror and bench (that was my favorite part) the blinds were automatic and it was so luxurious. Usually walking into hotel so fancy as this one you feel a little intimidated walking in with untied boots, messy hair, looking like I just rolled out of bed but the front desk was so nice and so funny that I felt comfortable like I've been there for days. We got 8 complimentary drinking tokens and the concierge was giving us the run down of the amenities, where the lounge is, when breakfast is, etc. and when he was all done with his speech he quizzed us! I was laughing so hard by the time we got into the elevator because we both weren't listening and he knew that. He kept us in our toes! I really enjoyed that! There was nothing negative about our stay at this hotel. I felt like all my questions were dumb but they politely helped me and told me "no worries!" I walked out of there feeling like a new person. I have found the hotel that I will always be staying at when I come into town. Thank you so much, Kinzie Hotel (and Robert) for an unforgettable experience. I'm sorry this review is all over the place, but this hotel deserved one.

ProviderLocation: 20 W Kinzie St , Chicago, IL 60654-6392
ReviewText: Great place to stay! Just the perfect hotel to explore the city. Quiet and offers free drinks and a delicious complimentary buffet everyday. Very friendly staff. Really nothing to complain about. The rooms are spacious and have HBO channels.
ReviewTitle: Free drinks and daily complimentary buffet!

ProviderLocation: 20 W Kinzie St , Chicago, IL 60654-6392
ReviewText: A gem located in the hustle & bustle of Chicago's Riverwalk district. While you have your choice of the usual name brand hotels, this gem sits off the corner of some fast-paced living. The Kinzie hotel sneaks up on you in a kind of non-descript way. You think you're about to enter the lobby of an office building but it's the frontdesk entrance to the Kinzie hotel. The doorman was gracious enough to escort me to the frontdesk. The frontdesk personnel was friendly and efficient with completing the check in. I got the cardkey then took an elevator up to my room. The room was very modern with an elongated entry that lead to a living-room/bedroom combo with all of the amenities a guest would need. The views make you say "Wow"!! A spacious bathroom for 2. Great treats such as dou Terry-clothed robes. A shower/tub for two, even two shower heads. Wide mirrors. Plenty of towels. Breakfast bar is setup at the elevator area entry/exit area. Features a workout area with lots of equipment. Lounge and eatery on the upper level. Everything (dining, bars and attractions) is within walking distance to and from the Kinzie hotel. Comfort, urban class and upscaled living all-in-one.

ProviderLocation: 20 W Kinzie St , Chicago, IL 60654-6392
ReviewText: I have to remark how much I enjoyed the room itself for being unique and comfortable. I am both picky and potentially a snob...I want to be impressed and I want to be comfortable. I like a well executed boutique feel and Kinzie had it. I was impressed with Kinzie for: 1. cleanliness. great housekeeping. 2. a very nice continental breakfast - it was a broad assortment and maintained 3.good customer service (communication thru text was offered and welcomed) and 4. location to good eateries. FYI: I did not park at the hotel but did park down the street. I found the down the street parking to be reasonable not cheap. Cons: 1. The shower is not much better than good/average. No light in the shower and having a dual Speakman showerhead was a bit much in a smaller shower space. The bathroom was well presented otherwise. 2. cable/tv was a bit annoying and didn't offer paid programming.

ProviderLocation: 20 W Kinzie St , Chicago, IL 60654-6392
ReviewText: Stayed at the Kinzie Hotel for marathon weekend and everything about the hotel is excellent. Upon arrival we were immediately assisted by the awesome bellman and our check in experience we warm and helpful. Guest room was HUGE with HUGE windows overlooking the city, pay the extra for the corner king room! The cocktail reception was outstanding, really enjoyed the convenience. Breakfast is served daily on the landing of each floor, great selection and so convenient. Did I mention location? Wow this Hotel is in the middle of River North exactly where you want to be for food and convenience to downtown. Overall the experience was five star and can't wait to return!

ProviderLocation: 20 W Kinzie St , Chicago, IL 60654-6392
ReviewText: Stayed at the Kinzie Hotel for 5 nights. I got a great last minute deal on the room. The room was large and clean. Bed was pretty comfortable as well. The location was excellent and within walking distance to lots of restaurants and bars. I would definitely stay again!

ProviderLocation: 20 W Kinzie St , Chicago, IL 60654-6392
ReviewText: I was very impressed with my stay here at The Kinzie. The check in was great and the hotel is extremely clean and managed well The City View Room I got was great. I could see the Harry Caray's Restaurant from my room. The room had all you need: King sized bed - very comfortable, small refrigerator, a safe that held my 13" Macbook easily, full length mirror on the the closet, Umbrella, Iron and Ironing Board and of course a hair dryer. They use the H20 brands for soaps and they were great. The double shower head was nice. This hotel is convenient to everything downtown. I do recommend you take the Lake/Clark Blue Train to Lou Mitchell's. Had (2) great breakfasts there. I also enjoyed Eggsperience for breakfast as well. If you want a good Italian Meal I enjoyed Tre Soldi off Ohio Street. The Continental Breakfast the serve every morning was nice. Fresh Coffee, danishes, OJ, cereals, boiled eggs - nice surprise. I will definitely be returning to The Kinzie. The price was right and the location great!
ReviewTitle: Great place to stay in Downtown Chicago

ProviderLocation: 221 N. Columbus Drive , Chicago , IL 60601-7801 221 N. Columbus Drive , Chicago, IL 60601-7801
ReviewText: Stayed here for a quick weekend getaway. Right near Michigan and Wacker. Very chic modern hotel, nice and clean, pleasant staff. Room was gorgeous, nice floors, spacious bathroom with separate tub and shower with barn door entry. Hotel has a wonderful fitness center complete with multiple pieces of equipment, free weights and plenty of cardio equipment as well as a small half court basketball court and outdoor track. Seriously better than some health clubs, also had a steam and sauna that we didn't check out. We came in the winter, has what looks like a nice outdoor lounge area and pool. Indoor they do have a two lane lap pool and small hot tub. Very pleased with the hotel as a whole will be back. Only con I will say was the hotel restaurant. Was pretty pricy for what they offered and we came at 10:30 pm just to get something small and they had already closed the kitchen because no one was there.
ReviewTitle: Solid 4.8. Great hotel, good service, perfect locations

ProviderLocation: 6550 S Cicero Ave , Chicago , IL 60638-5804 6550 S Cicero Ave , Chicago, IL 60638-5804

ReviewText: Quiet night for good nights sleep with a good price for keeping our car. Staff was friendly and informative. Close to airport, so we could relax the night before the flight. ProviderLocation: 6550 S Cicero Ave , Chicago , IL 60638-5804 6550 S Cicero Ave , Chicago, IL 60638-5804
ReviewText: This is a new hotel with large rooms and friendly professional service. You can order food 24 hours a day, we had the grass fed hamburgers which were OK. The service was amazing, very helpful employees. When the kitchen could not contact us in our room about our order, a helpful employee came up to deliver the message.
ReviewTitle: Comfortable large room, great service, and food!

ProviderLocation: 6550 S Cicero Ave , Chicago , IL 60638-5804 6550 S Cicero Ave , Chicago, IL 60638-5804
ReviewText: When thinking of this type of hotel, one that would be close to the airport, have convenient transportation to the airport, and be sound-proof enough to cancel out airport noise, this hotel hit all the right marks. The hotel is fairly new (less than two years old I believe), and it still feels new. Our room was very comfortable. We asked about upgrading to the corner room, but were very happy we didn't. The room was spacious, bed was comfortable, and you can't hear a single plane. The hotel does offer a pool and fitness facility, so if you're traveling on business you have some amenities. There is also a large breakfast area, along side a bar/restaurant. Transportation to the airport runs all night using the same shuttle the surrounding hotels use. Pickup, drop off and getting back to the hotel is very simple, and the drivers are pleasant. One great perk, offered at the time of our stay but not sure how long it will last, was the ample free parking the hotel offered with our stay. Most surrounding hotels have a surcharge of $15-$18 per night, but this hotel was still offering 14 free nights of parking. That fact alone makes this hotel a steal. On top of a free night certificate, makes it a no-brainier. We really enjoyed our stay before our trip, and we definitely stay again.

ReviewText: Kimpton hotels are always great, but this hotel is excellent for service, price, and accommodations. So central in the Downtown Chicago Loop with a short walking distance to Millennium Park and the Art Institute. Room was exceptionally nice with best pillows ever experienced in a hotel.

ProviderLocation: 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel) 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: Loving Kimpton hotels and this one did not disappoint our room was quiet and had decent amount of space. Everything works as expected. The staff were just terrific. All the services were on point. We love the wine hour which takes place daily in a beautiful space close to the lobby. The location is perfect. It's close enough to walk to many of Chicago's attractions and restaurants. Some other places like boys' town is just a short uber ride away. Highly recommended.

ProviderLocation: 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel) 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: I had a great stay here. First off, the location is fantastic-- it's right along the Chicago river, so access to the Miracle Mile above, and the parks below is really, really easy and walkable. The orange line is about 1.5 blocks away, and it seemed that all other rail lines were within a comfortable walking distance. I stayed in a River View Deluxe King room which was wonderfully decorated, and had a great view of the river and surrounding areas. Please note that photos on their website show that this kind of room will have the window seat bench-- however what they do not tell you is that there is only one of these kinds of rooms on each floor. The room I was assigned to originally did indeed have a river view, but no window seat bench. Luckily I was able to speak with the front desk and there was a room available that had one. Aside from this, the room was clean and served as a comfortable retreat after a day of walking and taking in the sights and sounds of downtown Chicago. The amenities offered in the hotel were great as well; from the wine reception to the hot chocolate that was available each and everyday. Signing up for the Kimpton Karma program afforded us free wifi, which was not the fastest, but still decent for basic online tasks like web browsing, e-mail, and social media at the least. I would definitely consider staying here again if I ever found myself back in Chicago!

ProviderLocation: 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel) 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: From the friendly wonderful staff to the wonderful welcome note in our room, this has made me a repeat customer! The room was spacious and beautiful. The window seat was a great place to read and enjoy the view. Cannot wait to come back

ProviderLocation: 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel) 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: I just stayed at the Hotel Monaco for 2+ weeks, and I couldn't be happier with my stay (the only thing that made me unhappy was having to check out). I chose the Hotel Monaco because I needed a place to stay with my dog (no breed restrictions, hooray!), and it ended up being just perfect for us. Mabel the pooch loved the dog bed they supplied (and also the people bed), and we both loved the easy access to the River Walk (thanks to a mild February, we had some lovely walks along the river to Navy Pier). The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and the room was nice and comfortable. The rate (I got an extended stay rate because of the length of my stay) was also very reasonable. I don't know what else to add - it was great!

ProviderLocation: 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel) 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: Spent one night at the Kimpton Monaco Chicago and had to review because the staff was WONDERFUL. I had a very speedy, less than 24 hour stay between and it felt like I had been there for days with how the staff treated me. They were so kind, so helpful, and always asked if I needed anything at all. The night audit team still there in the morning to check me out on Monday AM 9/19 were lovely. They made sure I checked that I had everything before I left and engaged in the loveliest of conversations for 7:30am! The doorman did the exact same, also asking if I had everything (chargers, phones, etc) from the room before I left so I wouldn't forget anything. I thought this was great. Genuine people from start to finish. The room was fabulous and the location was ideal. Quick to good dining, site seeing, and the train. I wish my stay had been longer! Thank you, Monaco! I will be back!

ProviderLocation: 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel) 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: So this hotel wasn't the most outstanding place I've ever been to. It was okay and I have no real complaints. When I got there I was early and asked if I could just check my bag but they offered a room. It was on the second floor. There was no good view at all. Couldn't see any river. Only traffic and the traffic was loud. I was going to use my alarm clock but didn't need it since the sirens woke me up every hour. I also didn't have a window seat. So that was a bummer. Plus, I didn't think of it at the time but every other place I've ever been to, the staff always tell me about all the amenities. This staff didn't say a word about one thing to me. I see in other reviews that gold fish were offered. Plus free bikes (didn't know about this). It would have been nice if they would have gone over the things they had to offer. Not so sure why they discriminate again certain guests but I paid for a room and should have gotten the same treatment as everyone else. Can't give an opinion on the free wine since I want there during that time. Otherwise, the bed was comfy.
ReviewTitle: Good location, not a great hotel

ProviderLocation: 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel) 225 N Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60601-2404 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Chicago - a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: HOTEL MONACO was my least favorite in the Chicago Kimpton Fleet! the rooms are not to my taste and the rates are extremely high. Ive watched the price point endlessly and for 300 dollars a night. i don’t feel that the hotel rooms lead up to the satisfaction of the guest price point. The lobby is beautiful it has the beautiful feel and the lobby smells great! The scent machine is at full scale making the lobby really enjoyable to sit in and enjoy. Im not so crazy about the happy or wine hour, even though I’m grateful that the company does it. it would be nice to see the company offer another drink other then just red or white wine, So far the other Chicago hotels along with Philadelphia had “ drinks of the summer” so if its champaign mixed with a fruit drink or a sangria I’m happy. I was disappointed that they only had white or red wine. for nearly 300 a night wish the hotel had some other options. Ive even been to hotels that had a fun non alcoholic drink for children. This one didn’t seem to have any of that. Check in never the less is speedy and fast! always great to rent a bike from the hotel and explore Chicago!
ReviewTitle: 5 Days in Chicago and 4 Kimpton Hotels !

ReviewText: I was under the impression that my room would have a window seat, but it did not. That was disappointing. Also, the floors creak... HOWEVER. This hotel is super cute and luxurious and made me feel like I was some rich celebrity for staying there. And there was a leopard print robe!! The hotel is situated in the perfect spot, and the staff is seriously THE BEST. They helped me ring in my birthday and I left feeling happy with my stay. The amazing staff definitely made up for the window seat. Thank you so so much!

ProviderLocation: 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago , IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower) 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago, IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower)
ReviewText: Stayed here one night for a Saturday wedding. VERY IMPRESSED! The lobby is all sophistication and elegance. The hallways and sleeping rooms are all vibrant, colorful, sleek and modern, with reds, oranges, yellows being the main color scheme. The building is all triangle angles, which makes the walk down the hall interesting, but don't worry, the rooms are regular layouts. Superior King room--comfortable bed, good night's sleep, large and spacious bathroom with both tub and shower. Bright and clean everywhere. The rate is very reasonable for downtown. Highly recommend.
ReviewTitle: Classy, sophisticated, modern elegance at a reasonable rate

ProviderLocation: 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago , IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower) 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago, IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower)
ReviewText: I wanted a weekend away. The architecture of the Sofitel always amazed me. I went to the hotel website and made sure that the fitness facility was high quality as exercise is important to me. When I arrived at the hotel, I went to the gym. I was directed to a small room that had a few pieces, think Hampton Inn. This is not a 5 star gym. The hotel should have said that it's gym was not functional and an alternative place should have been offered. I left after the first night and switched to another property.

ProviderLocation: 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago , IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower) 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago, IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower)
ReviewText: The hotel is in a great location - with Cab service very easy. Close to Michigan Avenue for shopping. The service at the hotel is excellent! We were disappointed the the bar was closed for remodeling as it was a favorite location to have a nightcap. They are also remodeling the gym / workout room.
ReviewTitle: We stay here when in Chicago many times

ProviderLocation: 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago , IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower) 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago, IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower)
ReviewText: In addition to the beautifully appointed lobby, public areas and room, the service of staff in retrieving - and esp. preserving for later retrieval - left behind Valentine flowers was above and beyond!

ProviderLocation: 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago , IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower) 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago, IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower)
ReviewText: Everything was perfect. This is the first time in years I have been perfectly satisfied with the entire stay including the Room, staff, location, room service, and cleanliness. There is nothing I would have changed.

ProviderLocation: 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago , IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower) 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago, IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower)
ReviewText: I upgraded to a suite upon check-in. In the room, there was a random bent wire hanger hung over the back of a door. Not a big deal, but I'd expect housekeeping to remove it when they serviced the room. A few minutes later, housekeeping came by to ask when I was checking out. I said I'd just checked in. Maybe they hadn't finished cleaning, it's not clear, but obviously a breakdown in their service processes. The rooms are eccentric (half-size double doors to the bathroom?), and dated, but the public spaces still look great. Later, I called to borrow an iPhone cord, which I forgot. I was told they were only available for purchase. Maybe my expectations are too high, but I was surprised. Other hotels, like Virgin, have accommodated the same request with no problem. When I mentioned it at check-out, I was told that they cannot keep charging cords for all their rooms. What? I only asked for one cord, not one for all their rooms! Supply does not work like that! I also discovered that what I had verbally understood as the charge for the suite was only the upgrade charge, on top of the original room charge. The response was to pull out a sheet of paper showing I signed that it was a surcharge (or supplement in their parlance). OK, my error. But I would not have expected it to be handled quite so legalistically. Just apologize for the misunderstanding, and make some conciliatory statement, like 'we'll try to do better in clearly describing the upgrade rates during check-in.' At no point during check-in did they quote the total rate before tax. Regardless, their service seems to be centered on policies, not customers. This is in stark contrast to great Chicago hotels such as the Langham or the Peninsula and even to less pretentious properties such as Virgin or any Kimpton.

ProviderLocation: 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago , IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower) 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago, IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower)
ReviewText: Great location, close to the magnificent mile Great staff and super friendly, they go the extra mile to make feel at home and special. Great room; very spacious . I can not recommend this beautiful hotel more.

ProviderLocation: 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago , IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower) 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago, IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower)
ReviewText: Stayed there for 1 night during my visit to Chicago. The location is really good as its centrally located and walking distance to the main tourist areas. I got an early check in after a long flight from Delhi which was a big relief. The rooms are spacious and nicely done. The hotel is 4* and value for money, and I would definitely recommend it..
ReviewTitle: One night stay in the heart of the City

ProviderLocation: 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago , IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower) 20 East Chestnut St - Downtown , Chicago, IL 60611 (Formerly Sofitel Chicago Water Tower)
ReviewText: Surprised this hotel has 5 stars AND great ratings. Stayed here just one night, and for me it seems like a great average 4 star business hotel. Not the usual Sofitel experience so be careful if you have high expectations. - The location is great for exploring Chicago. - The lobby is modern, dark and moody and smells great! - Check-in was quick but nothing personal. - Hotel corridors are bright and colorful - not really my thing. - Room was average but clean. Definitely not luxury and bed was incredibly soft. - They did have Lanvin toiletries - kudos! Wouldn't recommend or stay here again. There are better places in Chicago... Virgin Hotel, Peninsula.
ReviewTitle: Clean and modern but devoid of luxury or charm.

ReviewText: I return here every chance I get. All the details are carefully looked after as was I. The food the Service all of it is consistently excellent. Ask them anything and they will know it.

ReviewText: I stayed for a couple of days as a quick getaway, and this hotel was an excellent choice! The rooms were nice, clean and comfortable, and the breakfast was great! Great location, and near several shops, and restaurants. I would definitely stay again!

ProviderLocation: 5225 S Harper Ave , Chicago , IL 60615-4113 5225 S Harper Ave , Chicago, IL 60615-4113
ReviewText: This is an upscale, luxurious hotel for mid-range prices. I liked everything about this place. The location is fun. The building is new and gorgeous. Every member of the staff I met was a delight. My room looked brand new. I liked the contemporary design. Everything was immaculate. The couch was comfortable, as was the bed. I slept very well. I strongly recommend this hotel to you, even if you have to travel a bit to reach it; it's worth the trip.

ProviderLocation: 5225 S Harper Ave , Chicago , IL 60615-4113 5225 S Harper Ave , Chicago, IL 60615-4113
ReviewTitle: It served the purpose without breaking an arm and a leg

ProviderLocation: 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago , IL 60611-2751 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago, IL 60611-2751
ReviewText: We stayed at the ACME for a weekend trip up from southern Illinois. We loved the modern feel of the hotel and how close it was to downtown. Our only complaint was that upon arrival,being hungry for a snack after a 5 hour drive,one of the front desk concierges was rude to us when we asked if there was a vending machine inside the hotel. Not extremely rude,but you could tell he was offended that we would ask such a question. It did not ruin our trip,though,and other than that,we had a wonderful stay.

ProviderLocation: 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago , IL 60611-2751 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago, IL 60611-2751
ReviewText: I booked a "City View" room, and it didn't disappoint. We had great views from our 8th floor room towards the north of Chicago, and arriving after a trans-Atlantic flight, the view was, to use the local parlance "Awesome". The room was a little quirky in style and colour, erring towards urban grunge but was warm and clean and the queen size bed very comfortable. There are USB chargers and free WiFi. Alexa didn't understand my English accent though...she kept telling me to talk with a human... One a particularly cold and rainy night, we had cocktails in the bar, which is cosy and inviting, separated into small room areas and we nabbed a space to view the storm outside.. The bar tender was attentive and swift in his service and willingly reduced the volume of the music when requested, as it was just a little too loud to hear one another talk. We had breakfast in the adjoining bakery on one morning, and it was adequate, although the service was a bit sleepy. Locals seemed to be buying their breakfast here though, so that's probably a good sign. Check in and check out were easy and the porter hailed us a cab and carried our bags. Ideally placed for several eateries, pubs, inns, pizza places and up-market dining as well as shopping and the Magnificent Mile. Recommended if you're not into glitz, glamour and showy marble.
ReviewTitle: In the centre of the city

ProviderLocation: 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago , IL 60611-2751 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago, IL 60611-2751
ReviewText: We had a great stay at the ACME Hotel. The atmosphere was great, the rooms were clean. I really like the extra seating space in the room. the bathroom was modern. I will plan my next stay at the ACME.

ProviderLocation: 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago , IL 60611-2751 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago, IL 60611-2751
ReviewText: I would highly recommend staying here! It is a beautifully thought out hotel, with the best of everything, especially the staff. Jerome the concierge even helped me with a special request prior to my arrival. I will exclusively stay here every time I come to Chicago, without a doubt!

ProviderLocation: 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago , IL 60611-2751 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago, IL 60611-2751
ReviewText: For a hundred bucks this is a steal. The room we had was large, with a separate living room, a large bathroom and a large bed. The hotel staff was friendly and the location is great in that you are nearby many a location in downtown especially if you are a tourist.

ProviderLocation: 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago , IL 60611-2751 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago, IL 60611-2751
ReviewText: Long story, but I decided to snag a last minute room at Acme rather than drive the hour and a half back to my Chicago burb. I am so glad I did. Initially, I felt kind of weird checking into a hotel without luggage, but once again the staff made me feel like I was coming home. The folks who work here are superlative. I thought that I might explore the area a little bit but ended up spending a lovely couple hours at Bodega chatting with the staff (shout outs to Gabrielle and Mariah) as well as with employees from other nearby hotels who seem to come to Bodega after hours. The room gave me a good night's sleep, which I sorely needed. Rooms in this hotel is almost supernaturally quiet, and the bathrooms are funky-chic rather than being merely functional. I love this hotel.

ProviderLocation: 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago , IL 60611-2751 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago, IL 60611-2751
ReviewText: Went on a date. Got plastered. I live about 2 hours away. Ain't no way my butt was driving home in my condition. My date was kind enough to find a hotel for both of us. We got accommodated fast and at a very resaonable price! Hotel was clean. Bed was comfortable. I got all I wanted that night. Ayyyy

ProviderLocation: 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago , IL 60611-2751 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago, IL 60611-2751
ReviewText: Loved the hotel. Seeing the piece of artwork right outside my window was a delight. They turned a negative view into a charming view. Everyone was friendly and coffee in the morning was delicious. Beds were so comfortable and pillows great.

ProviderLocation: 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago , IL 60611-2751 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago, IL 60611-2751
ReviewText: A very comfortable bed, great service, delicious coffee at your door each morning. Not to mention the lobby bakery and it assortment of scone. Danish and juices. One of my bet stays ever in Chicago. It is conveniently located. The Berkshire Room looks like a great place to while away an evening.

ProviderLocation: 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago , IL 60611-2751 15 East Ohio Street , Chicago, IL 60611-2751
ReviewText: A quick few days in Chicago to escape life was made awesome by Acme. Great location. Great food and shopping nearby in every direction. Friendly knowledgeable front desk. Coffee in the AM and drinks late night located right off lobby. Easy (by Chicago standards) parking. Thanks for a smooth stay!
ReviewTitle: A few casual days in Chicago

ProviderLocation: 22 W Monroe St , Chicago , IL 60603-2410 22 W Monroe St , Chicago, IL 60603-2410
ReviewText: We had stayed at another Hampton Inn in downtown Chicago before and liked it. We chose the Majestic this time due to its location near the things we wanted to do. I was a little hesitant to book it because I wasn't sure if there would be noise from the adjacent theater, but there wasn't. Our room was actually the first one closest to the elevator, and we never heard any noise. We arrived around noon on a Sunday and were able to do early check-in and leave our car with the valet. Every employee we dealt with was very friendly. The room was pretty good size, by downtown Chicago standards. It was clean and comfortable. The free breakfast was very typical of other Hampton Inns--waffles, eggs, cereal, English muffins, pastries, etc. One note--the seating area for breakfast is smaller than other Hampton Inns we've stayed at, so if you want a seat, you probably need to get there early. We went to breakfast at 9:00 and couldn't find an empty chair. Taking our food back to our room was fine, though. All in all, it was a very good experience and I would recommend this hotel.

ProviderLocation: 22 W Monroe St , Chicago , IL 60603-2410 22 W Monroe St , Chicago, IL 60603-2410
ReviewText: Enjoyed staying here. It was close to good food and bus lines to take us to all the museums. Plus it was right above the theater Hamilton was at. Building was built in the late 1800's but the inside is very nice. Still some ornaments and items from the earlier days (Mail Chute). I would stay there again if I go back to downtown Chicago.

ProviderLocation: 22 W Monroe St , Chicago , IL 60603-2410 22 W Monroe St , Chicago, IL 60603-2410
ReviewText: Our check in was fast and our room was ready early, which is great when you arrive by train at 12. The staff was Awsome and so friendly. The breakfast was good tasting and the staff went above and beyond to help out with everything about our stay

ProviderLocation: 22 W Monroe St , Chicago , IL 60603-2410 22 W Monroe St , Chicago, IL 60603-2410
ReviewText: My wife and I went to Chicago for a special celebration after we scored great seats to Hamilton. We were lucky enough to get a room at the Hampton Inn Majestic and could not have been happier with our stay. From the personal attention from the GM, Howard Gottlieb, to the kind and courteous front desk staff, our stay was almost as good at the show! A special thanks to the entire hotel team for making our visit so special.

ProviderLocation: 22 W Monroe St , Chicago , IL 60603-2410 22 W Monroe St , Chicago, IL 60603-2410
ReviewText: We recently stayed at this establishment and were impressed with our stay. The location was perfect since we were attending a play (Hamilton) in the Private Bank Theatre (just went through a door in the lobby to the show). Our room was stylish, clean, quiet. The staff were polite and helpful. Breakfast was included in the price and far exceed our expectations in it's quality. The price on a Thursday night was about half of what I was anticipating the cost to be. Outstanding stay and an outstanding value.
ReviewTitle: Perfect in every way..even the price!

ProviderLocation: 22 W Monroe St , Chicago , IL 60603-2410 22 W Monroe St , Chicago, IL 60603-2410
ReviewText: I was happy to use my Hilton points on this as I was lucky to get tickets to Hamilton right next door. I got in and was a bit unhappy once I got to my room. It was small and a bit old school and tired in design. There wasn't a mini-fridge, which was a bit of a surprise. The bathroom design had the door blocking the shower, which was odd. The elevators are shared between staff and guests, so housekeeping and other folks would often hop on and delay guest movement on elevators, didn't offer to take another elevator if it was full with guests, which is the norm for hotels. There were 3 elevators, if even just one was dedicated for staff, it still would be faster with 2 than sharing it.
ReviewTitle: Great location, not so good service

ReviewText: If you're staying in Chicago to see Hamilton you can't find a better place to stay. Take the elevator to the ground floor, walk a few feet, turn left and you're in the theater. The hotel staff is great and very accommodating. The room clean and quiet. Breakfast was plentiful. Valet parking was easy. Have already made reservations to return to this great hotel. We loved this Hampton and Hamilton so much we're coming back soon.
ReviewTitle: Perfect for staying while seeing Hamilton

Would definitely stay here again.

ProviderLocation: 22 W Monroe St , Chicago , IL 60603-2410 22 W Monroe St , Chicago, IL 60603-2410

ProviderLocation: 22 W Monroe St , Chicago , IL 60603-2410 22 W Monroe St , Chicago, IL 60603-2410
