ProviderLocation: 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3583 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3583
ReviewText: Could not ask for a better stay so impressed . Perfect staff, location and view . Highly recommend! The car service made the travel way easier. Doorman new your name from moment you arrived till you left which impressed me. Room was very big and was amazing.

ProviderLocation: 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3583 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3583
ReviewText: Excellent experience, The staff was very attentive, the room was perfect, The staff answered any and all questions and made excellent recommendations. The views from the room were excellent ! I highly recommend this hotel and also the restaraunts, we ordered room service, food and coffee were excellent quality, coffee that rivals any premier coffee house.

ProviderLocation: 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3583 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3583
ReviewText: I would confidently state that Trump International is the best hotel in Chicago that I have been to (and I've visited quite a few luxury hotels in that city). It begins with the outstanding service of the team everywhere within the hotel (front desk, spa, fitness room) and end ends with a spotless cleanest facilities I have ever seen in a hotel. Location: centered, very convenient walking distance from all the city activities. Spa services (spa and fitness access are included with the hotel package; massage and other services are for an additional pay): amazing relaxing experience in the sauna, power shower and the pool, variety of relatively new cardio and weights equipment in great order. View: River view was fantastic. Room: everything has "Trump" logo on (you cannot possibly forget which hotel you are staying at :-)), technology equipped wherever possible, allowing maximum comfort for the guests. Price: expensive; recommend waiting for a good deal prior to making a reservation.

ProviderLocation: 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3583 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3583
ReviewText: This has nothing to do as Trump the President but a review of the actions and treatment that My wife and I received from the hotel staff at this hotel. I reserved a spa room for my wife and I for our anniversary weekend getaway. At the time of reservation they had no problem taking my credit card information for the reservation s but when we arrived to said hotel that was a different story we showed up to get the keys and enjoy our night together when they said that they would not except my card that I made the reservation with due to it being a prepaid card. Which is not specified in any part of the fine print in the contract of the reservation. So the first worker said that they just need a card with a name on it and it could be paid for with the original card. We told they not to change anything to that card as we did not have enough money on that card and no way to transfer funds for one account to the other since we were over three hours away from home and it was late on Saturday night. So they ran it it did not go through and the worked was told to cancel the transaction .He said he did and left to come back with a front end manager. Whom said that we could pay in cash so I went and pulled all the money I could for the day out of their ATM to cover the cost of the room and as I went to pay cash she told me it would be an additional $500.00 for the room because I was paying with cash. At this time my wife was fed up with the way that we had been treated by the worker and the front end manager that she stormed out and as I told them to just cancel the room the front end manager had no remorse for the situation and basically stated that it was not their fault and was unwilling to help in any way. So we even had to pay for the 1 hour long parking in their garage I was so disappointed in the way that they looked down on us and that they made it feel that we should not be staying there to begin with. And that hurt even more so my wife and I scrambled to find another hotel in the area at 7 pm at night and came across a wonderful hotel called the Parker House and it was a beautiful historical hotel much better than what I seem from the Trump hotel. They were more than happy to help us get the room and take care of us. But what was even worse is that the Trump hotel CHARGED US THE FEE FOR THE REGISTRATION TWO DAY LATER.... So we called our bank to see what the charge was and through our bank we even called the Hotel and the manager stated that that situation never happened and that we were charged as a no show and refused to refund the fee....So we were charged for the night and did not even stay there.. I will never recommend any of my friends or business partners that travel and stay in Chicago to stay at this establishment. And they all agree and will be spending there time and money at great hotel like Parker House while doing business in Chicago......I hope that they will see this and try to make it right but I will not hold my breath.....

ProviderLocation: 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3583 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3583
ReviewText: I travel a lot and this was one of the best hotel experiences I've had. Service was fantastic, the room had a sitting area and a kitchenette, great view of the city. Attention to detail in everything makes for a great customer experience. Only negatives, and minor ones at that, the restaurant and bar was a bit expensive, but you know that going in and the in room TV was almost too big (about 50 in). We'll be back.

ProviderLocation: 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3583 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3583
ReviewText: Took forever to make a simple reservation. I waited at least 10 minutes before I even spoke to a human being. Not to mention the Muzak was extremely annoying to listen to while I was on hold. Hotel was nice, but the service could have been better. Nothing special about this place.

ProviderLocation: 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3583 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3583
ReviewText: Very nice hotel with excellent amenities. Great view, great location. Staff is professional and courteous. Health club and spa are top notch. I did not get vale parking but it is probably worth the extra money.

ProviderLocation: 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3583 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3583
ReviewText: Beautiful room and love having a kitchen inside the room. The exercise room is huge with large amount equipment and weights to choose from and has a fantastic view. Location is walking distance to the train station, stores, restaurants and museums.

ProviderLocation: 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3583 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3583
ReviewText: I decided to treat myself and was surprised beyond belief. This could be the nicest hotel I ever stayed in. The design is very modern with extremely comfortable beds. It's located on Wabash just North of the Chicago River. You're walking distance to downtown restaurants and bars, the Magnificent Mile shopping district and the Lakefront to name a few. You'll never get bored in Chicago. One side of the hotel is for owners and the other side for hotel guests. The service is equally pleasant for both groups. Honestly, I didn't know what turndown service was and embarrassed myself. Be careful what you eat or drink in the stocked refrigerator. The cheapest item in there was a $7 water. A bottle of water sits on a night stand for $125. The room rates vary depending on holiday weekends or local events. Average per night is around $300 at the lowest and up to $700 for a standard king room. City taxes and hotel fees add another $60 to your bill. Hotel parking was around $52/day. Some rooms have a nicer view of the Chicago River. The others have nice views of the River North skyline. The rooftop bar is captivating but not open year round due to weather. What impressed me most was the tv in the bathroom mirror. At first I thought it was a security camera until I found the remote and turned it on. Secondly, the full kitchen with stovetop, dishwasher and REAL dishes. A Bose radio is standard for most luxury hotels. Your name appears on the tv screen to welcome you. Trump slippers and bath robes are a nice touch. Free wifi is available for hotel guests. If you're looking for style and luxury and have a few dollars to spend, Trump Towers is the place to be.

ProviderLocation: 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago , IL 60611-3583 401 N. Wabash Avenue , Chicago, IL 60611-3583
ReviewText: I just simply wanted to say that, if you want to get the best experience at this trump, you must stay at their executive king room facing south east. I am a firm believer of room with view, that said, this is possibly the best view that any hotel in Chicago could offer! Amenity wise, this hotel has a Michelin 2 star restaurant called sixteen and it is also a must try destination! Valet is a hefty $73 but with in and out privileges. My only down side is that the coordination of their house keeping and front desk isn't as smooth and the house keeping staff keep knock on my door without knowing my late check out. But it is a very nice hotel over all. And I have to admit, for someone's political perspective that I am totally against, he really runs his hotel impressively!
ReviewTitle: Lake, river and clock tower view!

ProviderName: The Alise Chicago - A Staypineapple Hotel
ProviderLocation: 1 W Washington St , Chicago , IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham) 1 W Washington St , Chicago, IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham)
ReviewText: Ideal location in downtown Chicago. Our room was small but immaculate and very attractive, with extravagant high beds with excellent mattress and comforters, and excellent water pressure even on the upper floors. All the hotel people we met were friendly and helpful. Excellent small fitness center; swift elevators. In the afternoon the hotel serves little cupcakes and coffee at no extra charge. We would choose this hotel again.

ProviderName: The Alise Chicago - A Staypineapple Hotel
ProviderLocation: 1 W Washington St , Chicago , IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham) 1 W Washington St , Chicago, IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham)
ReviewText: We have stayed at the Burnham several times in the past because we love the location and the awesome historic and lovely building. It has changed a bit since it became 'The Alise' owned by Staypineapple a few months ago, but overall we had a similar pleasant experience. The rooms are small, of course, but well designed. The decor is a bit more plain than I remembered. The bed was lovely with two individual comforters that were fluffy and good smelling. No top sheet? It was so warm sleeping (even with the room temp turned down to 66), that in the middle of the night we had to go looking for a sheet and blanket in the closet. We found a set in a sealed plastic cover that, when opened, smelled musty/dusty and obviously had never been used. Having said that, we loved the pineapple logos embroidered on the blanket, as well as a pillow on the bed. The Tommy Bahama bath products are also pineapply/coconuty. And there are chilled pineapple infused water dispensers in the lobby. Good job with the branding Staypineapple company! We were a bit disappointed in the redesign of the Atwood Cafe in the hotel lobby, but that is for another review. The front desk staff were great and the valet/bell captain (I wish I would have gotten his name) was so helpful and accommodating. Our only issue was with a mix up upon arriving. I called the day before and talked to a young lady and asked if the valet for the car would be on Washington or State street. She did not know so put me on hold for at least 4 minutes then came back with an answer: State St. So when we pulled up to the corner and turned on to Sate St we were in a marked 'loading zone'. I ran over to the hotel entrance (on Washington) and was told that we would have to go around the block to meet the valet back on Washington. Later I told the valet and front desk about my conversation on the phone and they were perplexed. Maybe evidence of the new establishment? Employee training? All in all a very nice stay, though!

ProviderName: The Alise Chicago - A Staypineapple Hotel
ProviderLocation: 1 W Washington St , Chicago , IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham) 1 W Washington St , Chicago, IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham)
ReviewText: In addition to the top notch condition of this hotel, the staff are nothing short of amazing. Every single team member greeted us with a generous hello and a huge smile. No need was unmet and no detail overlooked. The location is absolutely perfect and I cannot wait to go back. This is my new go-to hotel in Chicago! Thanks to everyone there!

ProviderName: The Alise Chicago - A Staypineapple Hotel
ProviderLocation: 1 W Washington St , Chicago , IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham) 1 W Washington St , Chicago, IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham)
ReviewText: We were in town for my birthday but it also happened to be the Chicago Marathon weekend. We got there early hoping we'd just be able to park the car and check our bags so we could go out & aboutand they actually allowed us to check in which was great. They were very helpful with all the marathon event info since it would be running right past the hotel they told us how to best avoid issues around the race. When we came back from being out for the day they had cupcakes and a bottle wine waiting for me for my birthday. The room we stayed in was a little small but great & had everything we needed. The hotel is this neat little historic building that has a lot of charm. We were seeing a play & the theater was real close. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to a lot of the things, and the staff is wonderful would definitely stay here again.
ReviewTitle: Nothing but good things to say.

ReviewText: perfect location in downtown Chicago, walking distance to shopping centers and many major attractions. I love the keys to the hotel, it is not common to receive actual keys instead of key cards to your room. Ask for a high floor room, the restaurant downstairs can be noisy. I love their waffles but the orange juice is not freshly squeezed.

ProviderName: The Alise Chicago - A Staypineapple Hotel
ProviderLocation: 1 W Washington St , Chicago , IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham) 1 W Washington St , Chicago, IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham)
ReviewText: I stay at Kimpton Hotels every chance I get. Hotel Burnham was especially exquisite due to its history (it was one of the most prominent skyscrapers at the time it was built) and has the original iron work in front of the elevators. The rooms still use metal keys but are well-appointed with a well-stocked mini-fridge. I recommend joining Kimpton Rewards for perks like free wifi and drink coupons. I had a great view and appreciated the location near the Red Line. The service was impeccable as always. Would definitely stay here again!!

ProviderName: The Alise Chicago - A Staypineapple Hotel
ProviderLocation: 1 W Washington St , Chicago , IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham) 1 W Washington St , Chicago, IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham)
ReviewText: The hotel is in the Reliance Building, which was built in the 1890s and has been fully refurbished. Several floors (the top floors) have marble walls in the hallways and other fixtures from the original building. (There was a phone on a small table in the hallway that looked like it was from the early 20th century.) There is an extra charge for staying in one of those rooms; I did stay in one and was glad I did. The room was a good size, with a high ceiling, and nicely furnished. (The bathroom was small, however.) The hotel is right on State Street, in the heart of the main shopping area, and the foot traffic can be a little hectic, especially on weekends. It is near the "L" (elevated train and subway line) stations. The restaurant is pleasant, with a high ceiling and a view of the street and some outdoor tables. The hotel has a fitness center; it is well-equipped but small and could be hard to use if a few people were trying to use the weight equipment at the same time.

ProviderName: The Alise Chicago - A Staypineapple Hotel

ReviewTitle: Reminds me of a fine European hotel

ProviderName: The Alise Chicago - A Staypineapple Hotel
ProviderLocation: 1 W Washington St , Chicago , IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham) 1 W Washington St , Chicago, IL 60602-1603 (Formerly Hotel Burnham)
ReviewText: I stayed one night at this stunning, unique looking hotel. The main reason for staying at Hotel Burnham was due to it's close proximity to Chicago Theater where I attended an Avett Brothers concert. The service at check-in & check out was pleasant and quick. The complimentary glass of wine at check in was nice. I really liked the exposed iron railings around the elevator and up the stairwell. The room was small, but plenty of area for a solo traveler. The bed was extremely comfortable, like I was sleeping on a cloud. I'll definately stay again in the future and would highly recommend.

ProviderLocation: 11 S La Salle St , Chicago , IL 60603-1203 11 S La Salle St , Chicago, IL 60603-1203
ReviewText: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend in Chicago in February. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Everyone said hello and the lady at the registration desk anticipated our need for a map. Breakfast was very good and the seating quite nice - comfortable seats and plenty of room. Our room was a king studio with a larger than expected kitchen. Very clean and more than adequate for our purposes. Location is outstanding for exploring the Loop particularly the area theatres. Easy walk for us to Michigan Avenue, the train station, and State Street. Would definitely stay here again.
ReviewTitle: Helpful and friendly in great location

ProviderLocation: 11 S La Salle St , Chicago , IL 60603-1203 11 S La Salle St , Chicago, IL 60603-1203
ReviewText: We stayed here for 8 days, the first 5 with our son who slept comfortably on the roll-out couch in the lounge. This is a great apartment hotel. Our room was very spacious, well-furnished and had a very comfortable king size bed in the separate bedroom. The complimentary breakfast was a cut above the normal for hotels. It offered an excellent variety of hot and cold food. One day they even allowed us to make our own pancakes! The lounge, used for breakfast and then as a bar for the rest of the day, was spacious and had several different areas where you can sit, in a quiet place or right up at the bar. The hotel also has an attached restaurant which we went to the day the All Blacks lost to Ireland, having decided to avoid Irish bars. The dinner and service were both excellent and we were seated at a great table despite not having a reservation. The staff at the hotel were exceptionally helpful and friendly which made our stay all the more pleasurable. If/when we visit Chicago again we will definitely stay here. Plus we’ll also now consider other Residence Inn properties in future.

ProviderLocation: 11 S La Salle St , Chicago , IL 60603-1203 11 S La Salle St , Chicago, IL 60603-1203
ReviewText: My husband and I visited this hotel for New Year's Eve, we loved our room(1606), it was plenty of space and in a nice quiet location for just the two of us. We had a full kitchen, so we brought our own grocies in( but if you forget anything, they will deliver groceries to your door for free). You do pay for the food , but how nice is that. Everyone was nice and upon arrival we were greet by several staff members upon entering in hotel. We enjoyed the decor of our room so much, we decided to just entertain there to bring in the New Year and boy did we have fun(like we were kids again). Now they have a free hot breakfast for you to enjoy, but it started at 7am on New Year's day and I had to work. Parking is not onsite, a block away, not too bad, but we still recommend this hotel and plan to visit again.

ProviderLocation: 11 S La Salle St , Chicago , IL 60603-1203 11 S La Salle St , Chicago, IL 60603-1203
ReviewText: Stayed for 3 nights (Thursday, Friday, Saturday) right after Halloween. The hotel was hopping with Cubs fans (the parade was Friday). The hotel staff was very efficient in checking us in and I have to say that the staff in the lounge at breakfast was also efficient. Dirty plates whisked away quickly, turning over tables quickly, and replenishing plates and food for the complimentary breakfast. The room was a corner room on the 21st floor, and was very quiet. My Marriott profile does call for foam pillows which I did not have, but otherwise housekeeping was very thorough and during the day - each late afternoon when we returned to the hotel the room was ready. A couple of quirks - you could smell cooking odors. I woke up one morning at 4:30 to what smelled like bacon (someone cooking in their room perhaps). Also, if you are on the side of the hotel with the CTA stop as we were, you are going to hear the subway trains, no getting around that. And finally, as a Marriott premier member I was a little surprised that upon check-in there wasn't a bottle of water or some other 'thank you'. Not a big deal, but staying at Marriott's almost exclusively, it's a nice little perk to see a couple of chocolates in the room with a thank you note (as was earlier in the week at the Montreal Marriott Residence Inn). As far as value goes, the room was well over $300/night, so value is individual. For me, the location was the prime thing. The GO bus from the airport drops you right at the door (and picks you up there as well). The concierge was very good at giving us directions and maps. All in all, a good hotel.

ProviderLocation: 11 S La Salle St , Chicago , IL 60603-1203 11 S La Salle St , Chicago, IL 60603-1203
ReviewText: From start to finish, the hospitality and service were top notch. Hotel was not far from subway station or anywhere else you wanted to go. We were upgraded to a nicer room with an excellent view. A little tricky getting to the higher floors, but once we figured it out, it was no problem at all. We will be staying here again. More affordable than other hotels in the area.

ProviderLocation: 11 S La Salle St , Chicago , IL 60603-1203 11 S La Salle St , Chicago, IL 60603-1203
ReviewText: I recently stayed at the Residence Inn - Chicago Downtown/Loop and was very impressed by the hotel. Although this is not a new building, it is a new Marriott hotel and the rooms are very modern and clean. Prices may vary by demand, but I was able to get a great deal on a nice studio suite at this hotel mid week and was very happy with the modern hotel, price, service, and location. I did not require much service so I will not comment on that much, other than that every member of the hotel staff that I met was very cordial and friendly. I will comment on the location though, since this hotel is very well located for access to most of Chicago's main attractions. The Loop "El" line is close by for easy subway access to most of the city, and the theater district is within walking distance as is Grant/Millenium park. For other locations such as River North, Lincoln Park, Magnificent Mile, these are walkable on a nicer day, but a very easy cab or Uber ride on any day. I think this hotel would be great for families wanting to experience Chicago, or anyone needing a nice hotel with spacious kitchen suites for their stay.

ProviderLocation: 11 S La Salle St , Chicago , IL 60603-1203 11 S La Salle St , Chicago, IL 60603-1203
ReviewText: When I come to Chicago, I usually bid on priceline and have to take whatever I get. The Residence Inn was assigned to me and I was pleasantly surprised. The room was large, had a kitchenette, and was newly furnished and perfectly maintained. The design is elegant minimalism. Decent breakfast, great Loop location.

ProviderLocation: 11 S La Salle St , Chicago , IL 60603-1203 11 S La Salle St , Chicago, IL 60603-1203
ReviewText: I must say that this must be one of the best or the best hotels I stayed is the US. I was here for 2 nights during the Chicago Marathon. It was opened in 2015 - about a year old. Certainly the interior looks new. It's set-up as serviced apartments but still reasonably priced compared with similarly located properties in Chicago during this period which is peak. The studio room I stayed in is roomy and comfortable - about 40 sq metres. It had a sitting area, work area, walk in wardrobe, a large comfortable bed and a large bathroom (no bath, shower only). I cooked my own pasta dinner in the fully equipped kitchen the night before the marathon. They have larger rooms that can accommodate more people. Other than room size, what you won't find in many other hotels in the US with a more decent buffet breakfast - not the standard in super luxury hotels especially in Asia - but among the best I've had in the US for similar class hotels. The selection changes (a little) day to day as well. On the day of the marathon, they were very considerate to the marathon participants by starting the breakfast earlier at 6am - earlier than the normal 7am. For those who wanted to leave for the start area even earlier, they had continental breakfast - doughnuts, bakery stuff, coffee and other drinks from 4.30am. I arrived earlier than check-in time and they let me have something to eat at the buffet even though I was not entitled to and I don't know many hotels which would have allowed me to. Check-in time was officially 4pm but I had my room by 12noon. The staff were also friendly, courteous and helpful. Express check-out was a really helpful service and a breeze. They also have a guest laundry and gym but I used neither.

ProviderLocation: 11 S La Salle St , Chicago , IL 60603-1203 11 S La Salle St , Chicago, IL 60603-1203
ReviewText: Beautiful all suite hotel in the heart of downtown Chcago's loop. Can walk from Union Station or Millennium Station to the hotel. On La Salle street in the financial sector. Can walk to Willis Tower, The Chicago Institute of Art, even to boats for Architectural tours of Chicago by boat. Walk to Milkenium Park and see 'The Bean' or over to. Grant Park to see the Fountains. Free Breakfast buffet every day! I was worried that my room might be noisy as I was staying during Lollapalooza weekend. There was noise in my hallway, but once inside, my suite was quiet. Nice showers and good furniture to sit on. The bed was great for sleeping! Great hotel....even candy in the lobby Marriott...this one does your name proud!

ProviderLocation: 11 S La Salle St , Chicago , IL 60603-1203 11 S La Salle St , Chicago, IL 60603-1203
ReviewText: First of, the location is central. It will just take you, at the most, 15 minutes to get to Millennium Park, Willis (spelled S-E-A-R-S) Tower, Mag-Mile and the river. The area may be a little quiet during the weekends since offices are closed, but nonetheless, its a great place. Thera are also numerous food choices and a couple of convenience stores nearby. The Hoyel is new, with contemporary design in architecture and large photo frames of what is Chicago. Signages are present so you won't get lost and having the reception at 2F is a neat idea. The room I stayed in was great, the space is generous and the kitchenette yields endless possibilites for personal dining. T&B Facilities was also great and clean, though the rubber seal at the shower area may need to be checked regularly due to wear-and-tear, but all-in-all, it was good. The Staff was very accommodating and very friendly. After the initial interaction, it felt like they've known you for quite a while. They know your name already and have a hint on what you are going to ask them, hehehe... This might be the only Hotel I would ever consider, if I am going back to Chicago, unless otherwise instructed. Hahaha!
ReviewTitle: Hotel is a must GO, when going to Chicago!

ProviderLocation: 101 E Erie St , Chicago , IL 60611-2812 101 E Erie St , Chicago, IL 60611-2812
ReviewText: We stayed there for two nights, and were extremely pleased with our room, the staff, and the location of the hotel. The room was spacious, and had some of the most advanced electronics I've seen in a hotel room, with a very large screen HD TV, electric drapes and sheers, extremely convenient outlets, and sophisticated lighting. The bed was very comfortable, with lots of large, down pillows. The bathroom was large, and had a separate room for the toilet at one end, and the shower on the other. There were two sinks, and plenty of counterspace. We enjoyed the Nespresso machine, and the electric hot water pot. There was lots of storage space and a safe that was at waist high level and easy to use. The room rate was very reasonable. However the pay per view movie charges at $17.99 were too high. Overall, we had a great stay. Highly recommended.

ProviderLocation: 101 E Erie St , Chicago , IL 60611-2812 101 E Erie St , Chicago, IL 60611-2812
ReviewText: Spent the weekend of 1/27 to 1/29 at the new Conrad to celebrate my wife's birthday. The new Conrad was about a 5 minute walk down Rush St from where the old location was at. Upon arrival at the hotel we were greeted by welcoming staff on the first floor, they asked what our last name was directed us to go up to the 20th floor where we would check in. Once on the 20th floor we were greeted by name by the front desk staff and check in was rather quick since I was able to pick out a room on the 14th floor ahead of time. Once in the room, the hotel staff was nice enough to have a bottle of champagne chilled with a hand written note wishing my wife a happy birthday. The room was very modern with all kinds of electronic switches for the lights and curtains. They also had a keypad by the door for the lights as well as options for privacy as well as to have your room serviced instead of that old cardboard sign that used to hang on the door. Bathroom was pretty big with a separate areas for the toilet and the walk in shower. We did not eat at the hotel over the weekend stay since we ventured out for our meals. The only negative I had is that the rooms are smaller than what we were used to but overall I would highly recommend staying at the Conrad to enjoy a weekend downtown.

ReviewText: This was my first time at the new location I kind of have mixed feelings about the place I think that their staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way to be accommodating at least most of them the decor that is a bit off in my opinion sure everything's brand new but the hotel still feels very dated with all the seventies color I guess that's what they were going for but definitely did not appeal to me with the Browns and oranges and blacks and gold Hotel seem very dark and old. ProviderLocation: 101 E Erie St , Chicago , IL 60611-2812 101 E Erie St , Chicago, IL 60611-2812
ReviewText: The Conrad Chicago is the correct choice of a luxury hotel when visiting North Michigan Avenue. The hotel is all-new, and is located just west of the Crate and Barrel store, which means it is a perfect location to walk to anyplace on the Magnificent Mile. The staff was helpful, well informed, and unfailingly pleasant from the first moment I came in from the cold blowing down Eire Street. Throughout my stay, several greeted me by name when I walked through the reception areas. Obviously this staff have been well trained to provide luxury level service at every interaction, yet they made it look effortless. There was none of that annoying vending and “cross-selling” that too many hotels feel they may inflict on their visitors. I felt like a valued guest, not a data point for a customer list. I’ve stayed at a few Conrad hotels—most are nicely decorated—but the Conrad Chicago is exceptional. Tasteful, elegant and restrained—but not so understated as to risk blandness or be “too safe.” The Chicago Conrad avoids the kind of dullness which passes for sophistication in some other hotels (including in some other Conrads.) The use of woods, fabrics, color and art is pleasing. My room (a standard) was pleasant, large enough, and with a large sofa. Even though I was alone for this trip, I appreciated that the bathroom was designed so that two could use it at the same time. The shower was large and sleek. The soaps, lotions and other amenities are high quality and generously sized—I forgot you need tons of skin lotion when visiting Chicago in the dryness of January, so I was grateful. The guest room was well engineered. For example, the sheers and blackout curtains are motorized and raise or lower at the touch of a bedside button. Excellent lighting; you could dim it when relaxing or make the whole room very bright to work or to get dressed. (Yes, I am a bit of a complainer about bad hotel lighting if rooms have dark areas.) Plenty of outlets for a laptop, phone or tablet, but no true desk area. Nice view of Michigan Avenue and beyond. The room and hallways were dead silent. Restaurant/café areas are adjacent to the lobby and repeat the open and sophisticated design. Great city views, but I did not eat there. I have stayed at several Magnificent Mile hotels, and yes, I would definitely choose the Chicago Conrad on a return visit. BTW, I was at first confused when I heard that this was a brand new hotel, so here is a word of explanation to other occasional travelers to Chicago. The original Chicago Conrad was located west of the Nordstrom’s. That property is no longer a Conrad hotel. The new hotel is a few blocks north (a better location IMHO), and is nothing like the old Conrad (a property that I thought had design and other issues.)
ReviewTitle: Luxury and service on the Magnificent Mile

ProviderLocation: 101 E Erie St , Chicago , IL 60611-2812 101 E Erie St , Chicago, IL 60611-2812

The restaurant has a fantastic view of Michigan street. The normal guestroom is comparatively small, which could be a concern for those people love spacious room. ReviewText: My sincere THANKS for the wonderful time I spent at the Omni Chicago Hotel. This stay was for a well-earned and well-deserved vacation, and you delivered superbly. As a new member to Omni and the Select Guest program, I was hoping my first visit to the Omni Chicago would work miracles in getting my batteries recharged and in reclaiming my sense of rest, even though my visit was shorter than I'd wanted. You set the bar high, and you exceeded all my expectations. Thank you for your expert and friendly registration desk, your top notch housekeeping, a room service which has no equals (do thank April for steering me to the Root Beer Float :), your courteous doormen and bell staff, and the sheer beauty, comfortableness, and location of the hotel. Next visit, I must arrive closer to the check in time. Train travel isn't always "arrival time accommodating) so I chose to accept a comparable suite on a lower floor rather than wait for the 19th floor corner suite you had pre-selected for me. And yes, there will be a next visit. I have a milestone birthday coming up on July 19th - my 60th birthday. I can't think of a better gift to myself. Such an occasion deserves the best. Thank you, thank you again.

ReviewText: This was one of many times I've stayed at the Omni in Chicago. It's well worth the price for the room and the service. It also has a fantastic location. It's located right off of Michigan Avenue, in a rather central location for all the attractions. You can easily walk to any destination or grab a ride. There are restaurants off of Rush Street a block away and a number of bars and clubs nearby. You honestly won't be staying in your room, but if you do, know that it's very quiet, peaceful, clean, and the king-sized bed is something you really have to try to really know what you're missing. I usually visit on Christmas Eve, so I have to give a shout out to the employees who work those days. Thanks, all!

ProviderName: Hampton Inn Chicago Downtown/N Loop/Michigan Ave
ProviderLocation: 68 E Wacker Pl , Chicago , IL 60601-7204 68 E Wacker Pl , Chicago, IL 60601-7204
ReviewText: For a last minute decision to spend NYE in Chicago, this was a great choice! One of the most cost-effective places in the city on a night of inflated prices - convenient location, great space, and excellent staff! Room was spacious and comfortable, well appointed. Overall decor capitalizes on the art deco theme of the original building very nicely. Mini-fridge in the room a bonus, as was the view of the corner of Wacker Place & Michigan Avenue. Lobby includes a small bar, and a mini-mart that offers standard beverages, adult beverages, frozen meals/snacks and a microwave. Staff was all pleasant and extremely helpful, and very mindful of guest comfort and security. Lobby activity was closely watched (especially late at night), and smoking in the hotel (a non-smoking facility) and late-night party noise was not tolerated. Location is super-convenient and easy walking distance to a ton of shopping and sight-seeing musts in the city. It's easy to overlook this place - it's on a short block between Wabash/Wacker & Michigan Ave. It's marked, but the signage really blends in (I misjudged the entrance and walked into the Hilton Garden Inn that's right next door!) With the location comes some traffic noise, but there's no helping that, especially on NYE - the hotel even posted with each check-in that they had earplugs available if the noise got to be too much for you! If I'm doing a "staycation", I like to try for something a little more "luxe", but for one night on a mission to see the NYE fireworks in person, this place was PERFECT for my needs. This Hampton Inn will definitely go on my list of hotels to check next time I need to stay in Chicago.
ReviewTitle: A (somewhat) hidden gem of a Chicago hotel: don't pass it by!
